strIntroduction: Visit Fuji-Q highland and have a ride on Fuji Airways, a wind and water splashes attraction near Mt. Fuji! strIntroduction: Join this tour program to enjoy a wonderful experience of fruit picking in Yamanashi this fall! Later on, you will visit Chateau Katsunuma and walk to Torii villa to have a lunch course and shopping with friends. You will also visit Koshu and experience harvesting a pumpkin there and visit Ichikoen to enjoy an all-you-can-eat fruit picking. At Ichikoen, you can compare the taste of two different grapes, enjoy all-you-can-eat grape, melon, apple, pear, orange, and persimmon. strIntroduction: Join this tour and enjoy walking on the foot of Mt. strIntroduction: Niseko is the most scenic town in Hokkaido. There are some opportunities for taking amazing photos of the countryside landscape. In this private DOWNHILL cycling tour you will visit some of the best spots and take amazing photos. Even if you have been there before, you will experience something different when riding a bike. Our private dowhnill cycling tours are a hybrid of the self-guided, and are also considered “semi-guided.” These tours are the same as self-guided with one primary exception: the addition of a support van rather than a ride-along guide. Here is the tour we have for our beginner or intermediate cyclists: -Private Downhill Cycling Tour in Niseko- Details: The easiest way to discover Niseko. Level: Relaxed and Moderate Total distance: about 14 km Duration: about 3 hours *Minimum amount is 2 people, Maximum 5 people. *The price includes; Rental bike, English speaking support, helmet, a bottle of mineral water. *This tour is available every day between Jun 5 and Oct 25th. strIntroduction: Visit Kyoto this Autumn to enjoy its wonderful fall foliage, which is more beautiful than the cherry blossoms in Spring! The fall foliage last for two months, and the leaves start changing in Kyoto sometimes in October. The peak of the fall foliage is in mid-November, and you can still see colors on the trees until mid-December. This tour departs from Umeda and Namba, and will take you to 6 different tourists spots by bus, which are perfect for fall foliage. The spots you will be visiting are as follows: - Arashiyama Arashiyama is the second most important sightseeing area in Kyoto, where many temples and shrines are located in this area. It is famous for the Arashiyama Bamboo Grove. - Tenryuji Temple This temple is the headline attraction of Arashiyama, and it accommodates an incredible Zen temple, which garden is one of the finest gardens in Kyoto that has a wonderful mountain views. During the fall foliage, the mountains and the trees will turn red. - Komyoji Temple This temple is a superb temple, that is rarely visited by the tourist. It has a beautiful Japanese garden that will turn red in Fall. - Tofukuji Temple This temple that is carpeted with maple trees, and spanned by three different bridges, will turn red in November, and the view from the Hojo Garden is wonderful during Autumn. - Nanzenji Temple The maple trees near the San-mon gate will look very beautiful on top of the moss during Autumn. - Tetsugaku No Michi (The Path of Philosophy) This path is one of the most attractive sightseeing spots in Kyoto. During the Spring, this path is full with the blooming cherry blossom trees, and during the Autumn, this path is full with the red maple trees. The schedule of the tour will be as follows: - Umeda 7:30 - Namba 7:45 - Arashiyama - Walk around Tenryuji Temple (90 min, including Arashiyama) - Stroll around Komyoji Temple (40 min) - Stroll around Tofukuji Temple (60 min) - Stroll & walk around Nanzenji Temple & Tetsugaku No Michi (90 min) - Umeda or Namba (18:30 - 19:30) Lunch box is included in this tour. Reservation is difficult to make, so don't forget to book this tour in advance! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Visit Kyoto This Autumn To Enjoy The Fall Foliage!

strIntroduction: Visit the famous spots for viewing flowers and enjoying delicious food in the outskirts of Tokyo that can be tricky to visit alone. After meeting at the Keio Plaza Hotel in Shinjyuku, the bus will head towards Hitachinaka, Ibaraki prefecture and make its first stop at Nakaminato for a delicious sushi lunch. Then the adventure will start at Hitachi Seaside Park where the bright red kokias and cosmos flowers are in bloom with a seasonally limited viewing! You will enjoy a superb view with flowers across 3.5 ha of vast land. Then you will visit the Plum Liquor Brewery. Plum liquor ("umeshu" in Japanese) is one of Ibaraki prefecture's specialty products which is widely consumed across the country. The brewery you will visit has been producing plum liquor since the Edo Era. Learn about the history of plum liquor and how it's made, and see the equipment used. You can also try some plum liquor. After plums are pears! Visit a fruit-picking orchard to experience picking pears and eat as much as you like! Chestnuts are specially offered during fruit-picking. After the all-you-can-eat, the bus will head back to Tokyo to drop you off near Shinjuku Station West Exit. this tour is provided by HIS
strTitle: Enjoy Autumn Activities at 1-day Hitachinaka Tour, Ibaraki!

strIntroduction: Take a cruise along five rivers in Tokyo! The cruise includes the Nihonbashi River, Kamejima River, Sumida River, Onagi River, and Ohyoko River. Guests can go on the exciting Koumon (Lock) ship elevator, and see an amazing view of Tokyo Skytree. Cruisers get a totally unique experience that you can't get on land. Nihonbashi is linked by the Nihonbashi River to some of Tokyo's major waterways, including the Sumida River, each with its own character and each offering a variety of excursions. They offer a view not only of the city's many famous bridges but of the dramatically changing face of the city. The river cruise is popular, and in some seasons sell out almost immediately. We offer a special plan for you. The following are three timetables (Select one): <9:40 Course> 09:40 Meeting up/Reception in front of Nihonbashi Uogashi Kinen Hi (Nihonbashi Uogashi Monument) 09:50 Boarding at Nihonbashi Pier 5 River Cruise 11:20 Disperse at Nihonbashi Pier <11:30 Course> 11:30 Meeting up/Reception in front of Nihonbashi Uogashi Kinen Hi (Nihonbashi Uogashi Monument) 11:40 Boarding at Nihonbashi Pier 5 River Cruise 13:10 Disperse at Nihonbashi Pier Check the Tour Conditions link below. voyag.in/2c7AgMg

strIntroduction: The Nihonbashi-Kanda River Cruise provides a glimpse of the contrast between premodern Edo and present-day Tokyo. The Nihonbashi Pier was completed in 2011, featuring ornamental caps replicating the original wooden bridge. Depart from this pier for a fun cruise and a history lesson on the Edo Period in Tokyo. Guests can get a unique view of the largest bridge on the Nihonbashi River, the Edobashi Bridge and pass underneath it. Depending on the tide you can almost touch the underside of the bridge! This area also connects some of Tokyo's major waterways, each with its own character and a variety of excursions. They offer a view not only of the city's famous bridges but the dramatically changing face of the city. The cruise is extremely popular and tickets sell out almost immediately. We offer a special plan for you. The following plan has two two different schedules (Select one): <9:40 Course> 09:40 Meeting up/Reception in front of Nihonbashi Yuraiki no Hi (Nihonbashi History Monument) 09:50 Boarding at Nihonbashi Pier Nihonbashi River & Kanda River Cruise 11:20 Disperse at Nihonbashi Pier <11:30 Course> 11:30 Meeting up/Reception in front of Nihonbashi Yuraiki no Hi (Nihonbashi History Monument) 11:40 Boarding at Nihonbashi Pier Nihonbashi River & Kanda River Cruise 13:10 Disperse at Nihonbashi Pier Check the Tour Conditions link below. voyag.in/2c7AgMg

strIntroduction: There's no better way to start the day than experiencing the wonderful feeling of gently ascending into a clear morning sky, and gazing at the picturesque scenery extending before your eyes from above - you'll literally feel on top of the world! Take lots of photos while feeling the gentle morning breeze caressing your cheeks and the warmth of the morning sun. Before you know it, you'll be on your way back down to the fields of Niseko and reliving that floating feeling. This is an accessible and fun way to experience the joys of hot air balloon riding, suitable for the whole family!

strIntroduction: This is a facility in Shinjuku, Tokyo, which lets you experience the mystic and exciting world of ninja! FAQ: Q1. What kind of facility is this? This is an interactive entertainment facility featuring ninja. Q2. Can you show me how to get there? It is a three-minute walk from the eye-catching Godzilla building in Kabukicho, Shinjuku, Tokyo. Q3. How many people can enjoy it at the same time? It is a hiding place of ninja, so we cannot let in a large number of people at the same time. The maximum capacity is 4 people per tour group. Q4. How long will a tour take? Approx. 15 minutes. Q5. Can you speak English/Chinese? We are sorry. Our staff can speak Japanese only, but descriptions in panels are also written in English, Chinese and Korean.
strTitle: Practice ninja skills at a Ninja Trick House in Tokyo

strIntroduction: The rice paddy art in Inakadate has become famous worldwide. The theme for this year's art is ""Godzilla Resurgence"" and ""Sanadamaru,"" the NHK historical drama. The art that uses land as a canvas constantly changes and is a must see while it lasts! There is also a tour of the workshop run by the sword smith, Mitsugu Nakahata who has crafted Japanese swords for many years in Inakadate. While listening to explanations from the sword smith, you can take a sword in hand for a close look. A lunch featuring local foods will be prepared. Enjoy a leisurely lunch at a farmhouse restaurant that doesn't' have a menu--it serves whatever has been freshly picked that day. The tour ends at an early hour so that afterwards you can readily travel to Oirase Keiryu (mountain stream). Spend a languid time eating meals made from whole Aomori apples and bathing in a bath overlooking the grand nature of Oirase. Schedule: Day 1 8:30 Gather at Joto Exit, Hirosaki Station; meet up with the guide and travel to Inakadate in a vehicle (van or regular taxi) 9:00 Arrive at No.2 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 9:40 Arrive at No.1 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 10:15 Tour Katana no Iori (Japanese sword workshop) and actually handle a Japanese sword 11:40 Lunch of local dishes at a farmhouse restaurant; Japanese meals are prepared from vegetables freshly picked that day from the restaurant's backyard garden 12:50 Tour Niji no Mart (popular local market) and shop *Go to roadside station on Sundays. 13:15 Arrive at main entrance to Hirosaki Station; end tour 13:26 Depart from main entrance to Hirosaki Station; take a bus to Aomori Airport (out-of-pocket cost of 1000 yen per person) 14:20 Arrive at Aomori Airport 15:00 Depart on free shuttle bus to Oirase Keiryu 16:30 Arrive at Oirase Keiryu Hotel 18:00 Dinner at Aomori Ringo Kitchen 21:00 Attend a lecture on nature in the vicinity by Mori no Gakko, which teaches the value of Oirase Keiryu Day 2 7:00 Breakfast buffet 8:00 Take a free shuttle bus; walk along the mountain stream 10:00 Depart from Oirase Keiryu Hotel; ride the shuttle bus
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aomori: Rice Paddy Art and Japanese Swords

strIntroduction: The tasting workshop is held on night time (after 22:00) as well as day time in Japonica Lodge located in front of Asakusa Station. So, you can join casually our workshop (40 min program) anytime you want. Outline of Workshop １: Select preferred 3 tea from 6 tea (Gyokuro, Kabuse, Sencha, Wakocha, Genmaicha, Houjicya) ２: Learn making tea while feeling the change of taste with temperature of hot water ３: Enjoy the different taste of each tea with Japanese confection Also the program participants are provided 15% off coupon for tea leaves, traditional teawear, so you will enjoy Japanese Green Tea in your home. All of our tea leaves from Wazuka. Wazuka is a town in Uji, Kyoto. This very small town produces up to half of the tea produced in Kyoto. It make a great amount of the renown, high-quality Uji-cha. Japonica Lodge has partnership with a cafe owned by the town, and specifically provides Wazuka-cha (tea made in Wazuka). We offer by far the most types of Wazuka-cha in the Kanto area so please stop by to enjoy the scent and flavor of some of the best teas in Japan. Japanese green tea is proven to be very healthy and beneficial for the body, brain, and soul. Try it, not only as a delicious drink, but also as part of your healthy diet!
strTitle: Participate in a Japanese Green Tea Tasting Workshop, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Learn to make sushi from a professional chef in Tsukiji, site of the world’s largest fish market. During this 2-hour workshop you’ll gain experience cutting fresh, raw fish and learn the art of rolling "maki" (sushi rolls) with a sheet of seaweed and sushi rice. Afterward, savor your creations made with several types of fish, depending on the day’s catch. Once you arrive to the designated venue, you can get ready for an authentic sushi experience. You will cut sushi, roll maki and learn about the art of sushi-making from a professional. First, you will learn how to prepare the fish. You will get raw fish to cut and be instructed on how to do so. You will prepare Maguro (tuna), Ikura (salmon roe) and three or four other kinds of fish, depending on the catch of the day. You can be assured that the fish that you will be using, will be of a high-quality. You will then be given a big container of sushi rice from which you will make small rice balls to be the base of the sushi. Later, you will put the raw fish and rice together to make the sushi. You will also be using real wasabi root that you will grind yourself! You will also be taught how to make maki, or sushi rolls. At the end of the class, you will be able to try what you have created.
strTitle: Enjoy Sushi Making Class with a Professional Chef in Tsukiji

strIntroduction: Visit Omagari to join the Omagari Fireworks Festival this summer! Omagari Fireworks Festival is one of the biggest fireworks festival of Tohoku region, which is held every year on the 4th Saturday of August. The fireworks is held on the dry bed of the Omono-gawa, a river in the city of Omagari, Akita prefecture. More than 760,000 spectators are expected to come from all over Japan every year. More than 30 fireworks manufacturers from all over Japan compete to show off their technique at this festival. You can enjoy the breathtaking view of Omagari Fireworks Festival without any hassles by joining this tour program. This tour program offers you two different schedule as follows: 2 Days Shinkansen Trip to Omagari Fireworks Festival with spectator seats and onsen stay: Day 1 - Departing from Tokyo/Ueno/Omiya/Utsunomiya/Sendai Station (7:44 - 11:00) - Arrive in Omagari Fireworks Festival Watch the fireworks at the spectator seats while eating a bento dinner - Onsen Stay Day 2 - Departing from the Hotel - Visit Hiraizumi Have your lunch by yourself - Arrive in Tokyo/Ueno/Omiya/Utsunomiya/Sendai Station (18:36 - 22:24) 2 Days Bus Trip to Omagari Fireworks Festival & Hiraizumi Day 1 - Departing from Shinjuku Tocho (7:00) - Omagari Fireworks Festival We will be arriving in the late afternoon, so you will not be able to watch the daytime fireworks. You can watch the fireworks from the spectators seat - Arriving in Hachimantai Onsen (26:00) Day 2 - Departing from Hachimantai Onsen - Visiting Hiraizumi and Chusonji Temple - Arriving in Shinjuku (21:30) You can choose either one of the programs to join the Omagari Fireworks Festival in Akita prefecture! Reservation is difficult to make, so we recommend you to use our service to book with no hassles! IMPORTANT: *This trip is available in Japanese only* - however we highly recommend this as a rare Japan experience that you can enjoy regardless of language.
strTitle: Join the Omagari Fireworks Festival in Omagari, Akita!

strIntroduction: We offer Kyoto-style home dish cooking in English! *or with English translator, depending on the availability of the instructors Course Detail: Contents/Recipe: Recipe A Sukiyaki Course Dashi tasting : Learn about Dashi, which is a basis of Japanese food. Dashi-maki Tamago (Japanese egg roll) : Cook simple side dish by using the Dashi and eggs. Special Sukiyaki: The traditional menu that has 400 years’ history in Japan, or commonly known as "Japanese Beef Hot Pot". Rice: the primary staple food of Japanese cuisines, which has long history in Japanese Culture. Mochi dessert: The sweets loved by many Japanese from old days. Matcha: Powdered-green tea. Let’s try making matcha tea and drink with Mochi dessert. Recipe B Temari-Sushi (Ball-Shaped Sushi) Course Special Price Campaign for New Course! Dashi tasting ：Learn about DASHI, which is a basis of Japanese food. Dashi-maki Tamago(Japanese egg roll)：Cook simple side dish by using the DASHI and eggs. Temari-Sushi: One type of sushi, Japan’s representative dish, with 700 years of history. Temari was initially made to be small and round so that it is easy for Maiko (apprentice Geishain Kyoto) to eat. It is made by putting a seafood topping of your preference on a vinegared rice. Date: every Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday Time: 4:00 P.M - 6:30 P.M. Number of Participants: 2 - 8 people *We also offer private lessons, where you are free to choose the time, date, and menu of your choice. As we are located in the middle of Kyoto City, close to Nishiki Market, it is conveniently accessible within from Kyoto City Subway and Hankyu Railway. Only 3 minutes from either station! SUMAYA Cooking Class was originally founded as a restaurant 80 years ago in Kyoto City center. It delivered high quality Japanese dishes to famous temples and companies, thus it has been much loved by the locals for several decades. Today, the 4th owner holds Japanese home cooking class. The authentic, traditional dishes are arranged to be easier so that everyone can learn easily. Here, we aim to teach and pass on the the charm of Japanese Cuisine, "washoku", not only to the locals but also to the world. Spread the passion and love for Japanese cuisine with us!
strTitle: Learn Kyoto Family Dishes, Cooking Class in Kyoto City
Reservation Service for Hotels in Japan

strIntroduction: This is an activity to experience two of the most attractive aspects of Japanese culture, the traditional kimono and the kawaii designs and fashion of Harajuku! Chose from a wide variety of kimonos with unique and kawaii designs by well-known kimono designer Yumi Yamamoto, who often uses flowers and fruits, unlike traditional kimonos. Then, put it on with the help of the staff who will walk you through the process. You can wear all sorts of accessories to enhance your outfit and when you feel you are ready, hit the streets of Harajuku and stroll around for two hours!, you will have plenty of time to pose, take pictures and show off! At the end, you will only need to return the accessories, under-dressing, obi (belt) and geta or zori (traditional footwear), but your chosen kimono will be yours to keep! There are over 20 varieties for both winter and summer for you to chose from as well as hijab styles for Muslim women, and even a few varieties for men! Don't miss the chance to live a unique experience strolling around Harajuku dressed up in your own kawaii kimono. this tour is provided by HIS
strTitle: Dress up in a kawaii kimono & stroll around Harajuku, Tokyo

strIntroduction: The soba-making master's house is in Kanagawa prefecture and it is around 1 hour drive from Tokyo. We will meet up at our office that is 10 minutes walk from Harajuku Station at 10:00 AM and move to the destination by car. Once we get to the house, a master will be your guide for a day. The number of participants is limited to 8 people, so hospitable service is ensured for each participant! There will be a translator to help you communicate so don't worry about a language barrier! You will spend around 3 to 4 hours at the house making soba and do what locals do. Other than soba making, the activities are to be decided depending on the situation. In other words, it is entirely up to you to decide what you want to do throughout the day. You can take a walk around the area, go grocery shopping or just chat with a soba-making master to hear their life stories. After the trip, we will head back to Harajuku Station and go back to Tokyo's city life.
strTitle: Spend half a day with a Soba Making Master near Tokyo

strIntroduction: When you are traveling with your family, it is great to share the fun time with them. However, when you have young children, sometimes you have to give up on visiting some places, just like romantic restaurants, bars, activities and etc. I want everyone who are visiting Tokyo to fully enjoy this fun and tasty and great city with a big hospitality for people. That is why, I am going to take care of your children (age of 1 and older) while you are going to visit those places you cannot go with your young children. ★☆★About myself, the babysitter★☆★ I am a 33-year-old female living in Tokyo. I studied Early Childhood Development at a college in Los Angeles California, and I used to work at the children daycare center as a certified Teacher in LA CA. I also worked at International Preschool in Omotesando Tokyo as a school manager for 2 years. ☆★☆I love children and I love to help people who want to enjoy their Tokyo stay！☆★☆ When you are looking for someone who can take care of your children, please let me know. I am going to have fun time with your children with fun Japanese traditional games just like Origami, and I also am going to help you to make appointments of the activities and reservations of restaurants you want to go!
strTitle: English Bilingual Babysitter Service in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Both fly boarding and hover boarding are the products of Zapta racing in France. The company makes unique equipment that allow participants to enjoy the water even more. These two are steadily becoming some of the most popular new marine sports in the world. On a fly board, you can jump to around 9 meters high. The machine emits jet water on the surface, which allows participants to jump high into the air. The view of the breathtaking Lake Biwa is amazing from up there, and it's a great way to enjoy both sports and Japan's beautiful natural setting. Hover boarding is more similar to snowboarding or skateboarding. This idea was coined from the movie, "Back to the Future". Instead of emitting jet water on the surface, the water is pushed towards the sides, allowing participants to be propelled forward up to 5 meters at 25 kilometers per hour. If it's your first time, don't worry! An orientation will be given before the activity so you can be sure you will feel both comfortable and safe. Feel the amazing power of the water jets as you fly across the lake. Make unforgettable memories on your trip to Japan!
strTitle: Enjoy Fly Boarding and Hover Boarding at Lake Biwa!

strIntroduction: At Oirase Keiryu, spend a languid time eating meals made from whole Aomori apples and bathing in a bath overlooking the grand nature of Oirase while surrounded by a forest. On Day 2, travel to the port town of Hachinohe where you'll be shown 8 backstreets with bars only found in a town where a unique port-town culture has been firmly entrenched since long ago. Get an early start on Day 3. Walk around an area full of old-fashioned markets, including Municipal Hachinohe Gyosai-Ichiba Market that was opened in 1953. There, you can enjoy talking with the chatty local ladies. The fresh seafood you eat at this area from bygone days is fantastic! This tour will energize you with nature and people power. Schedule: Day 1 14:30 Ride the bus from Hachinohe Station 16:10 Arrive at Oirase Keiryu Hotel; check-in 18:00 Dinner at Aomori Ringo Kitchen 21:00 Attend a lecture on nature in the vicinity by Mori no Gakko, which teaches the value of Oirase Keiryu Day 2 7:00 Breakfast buffet 8:00 Take a free shuttle bus; walk along the mountain stream 10:00 Depart from Oirase Keiryu Hotel; ride the shuttle bus 11:40 Arrive at Hachinohe Station 12:22 Depart Hachinohe Station for Same Station 12:52 Arrive at Same Station; reach Kofunato 13:00 Lunch at the seafood restaurant, Kofunato; eat sea urchin atop rice and the well-known iso ramen 14:00 Depart from Kofunato to go trekking 15:12 Arrive at Osuka; take the bus 15:23 Arrive at Tanesashi Kaigan Information Center; view information, rest at the café, etc. 16:00 Tanesashi campfire & outdoor cooking 18:00 Travel from Tanesashi Kaigan to downtown 18:30 Tipsy tour of Hachinohe backstreet bars 21:30 End of Day 2; stay overnight at a downtown Hachinohe hotel Day 3 *When touring from Mon.–Sat. 6:45 Travel to Fish Market No.2 7:00 Breakfast of the best seafood in Japan 9:00 Travel to Tanesashi Fishing Port 9:30 Sea kayak 11:00 Lunch cooked by Tanesashi fishermen 12:30 Trek along Yodo no Matsubara in Tanesashi Kaigan 14:00 Arrive at Tanesashi Kaigan

strIntroduction: Hachinohe is a town where a unique port-town culture has been firmly entrenched since long ago. After you leave Same Station to go bar hopping, the same neighborhood that was so busy with haggling during the day at the fish market becomes enveloped in quiet as the sunset glow turns to darkness. With lantern in hand, your guide will lead you to bars one after another while you take in the aroma of the sea air. Hostesses will welcome you with a smile and invite you into places from days gone by. At the last bar, top off the night with the Hachinohe ballad sung by staff and a dance by the hostess. Buy some souvenirs and be on the last train at 9:46. Feeling slightly tipsy, you'll head downtown where you'll be shown 8 backstreets with bars. From Day 2, travel to Oirase Keiryu. Spend a languid time eating meals made from whole Aomori apples and bathing in a bath overlooking the grand nature of Oirase. Schedule: Day 1 17:38 Gather at Same Station 17:45 Bar hopping tour of fishermen hideaways in Same Ginza 20:24 Depart from Same Station 21:00 Tipsy tour of Hachinohe backstreet bars 23:00 End of Day 1; stay overnight at a downtown Hachinohe hotel Day 2 7:30 Hotel checkout; go to Tanesashi Kaigan by taxi 8:00 Morning yoga at Tanesashi Grassy Area 9:00 Breakfast at Tanesashi Grassy Area 10:30 Trek along Yodo no Matsubara in Tanesashi Kaigan 12:00 Lunch cooked by Tanesashi fishermen 13:30 Go to Hachinohe Station from Tanesashi by taxi 14:30 Arrive at Hachinohe Station; ride shuttle bus 16:10 Arrive at Oirase Keiryu Hotel; check-in 18:00 Dinner at Aomori Ringo Kitchen 21:00 Attend a lecture on nature in the vicinity by Mori no Gakko, which teaches the value of Oirase Keiryu Day 3 7:00 Breakfast buffet 8:00 Take a free shuttle bus; walk along the mountain stream 10:00 Depart from Oirase Keiryu Hotel; ride the shuttle bus 11:40 Arrive at Hachinohe Station

strIntroduction: Fully enjoy the beautiful scenery of Tanesashi Kaigan. There is a pathway offering an easy trekking course. All 5 of your senses will be stimulated by pleasant sea breezes on your skin, the sound of the waves, the smell of the ocean, and the soft ground of the pine forest. Data has been released showing that walking along the Tanesashi coastline relieves stress and is good for your health. At the fishing port located at the end of the trekking path, you can experience the life of fishermen and enjoy a meal made with freshly caught seasonal seafood. In the evening, head to Oirase Keiryu where you'll go from the ocean to being enveloped in a forest. Spend a languid time eating meals made from whole Aomori apples and bathing in a bath overlooking the grand nature of Oirase. Schedule: Day 1 10:39 Arrive at Tanesashi Kaigan Station; go to Tanesashi Kaigan Information Center 10:50 Trek along Yodo no Matsubara in Tanesashi Kaigan 12:00 Lunch cooked by Tanesashi fishermen 13:30 Travel from Tanesashi to Hachinohe Station by taxi 14:30 Arrive at Hachinohe Station; take the shuttle bus 16:10 Arrive at Oirase Keiryu Hotel; check-in 18:00 Dinner at Aomori Ringo Kitchen 21:00 Attend a lecture on nature in the vicinity by Mori no Gakko, which teaches the value of Oirase Keiryu Day 2 7:00 Breakfast buffet 8:00 Take a free shuttle bus; walk along the mountain stream 10:00 Depart from Oirase Keiryu Hotel; ride the shuttle bus 11:40 Arrive at Hachinohe Station
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aomori: Experience the best of local nature

strIntroduction: The courses are based of the Ichiju-Sansai concept, which consists of rice, soup, a main dish and 2 side dishes. You can learn how to use the Japanese seasonings and fresh ingredients. Please choose the course when you have a reservation. After confirming your booking, I will arrange the details. 1) Sushi course: Cook 2 kinds of home-style sushi, Temarizushi (ball sized sushi) and Chirashizushi, with seasonal fresh rare fishes 2) Chicken course: Main dish (ex. Fried chicken, Teriyaki etc.), 2 side dishes, rice, miso soup, desert 3) Seafood course: Main dish (seasonal fresh seafood), rice, miso soup, 2 side dishes, desert 4) Tofu&Vege course: Main dish (ex. Tofu stake), 2 side dishes, rice, miso soup, tofu desert 5) Japanese curry course: Chicken curry & rice, 2 side dishes, desert 6) Japanese vege curry course: Seasonal vegetable curry & rice, 2 side dishes, desert * For Muslims: All courses are available * For Vegetarians: courses 4 and 6 are available Please let me know the following info when you make the booking: - Name/Age/Gender/Nationality of each participants - Hotel name - Course number and name (only 1 course) - Food restrictions or allergies (if you have) Policy for Muslims : All ingredients are Non-pork and Non-alcohol. Other cookwares and dishes are not separated whether HALAL or not. I am not Muslim, but I have enough knowledge about HALAL. If you have any anxious, please let me know in advance. strIntroduction: Join a unique Samurai Boot Camp in Gifu's countryside from July 16 to July 18, 2016! The popular certified swordsmith Taro will teach you and other enthusiasts from Japan and abroad how to forge your own samurai knife from scratch! This is the ultimate blacksmith experience combining outdoor activities and multi-cultural interaction! Enjoy the peaceful riverside nature of Gifu prefecture and make your own samurai knife - a wonderful souvenir from your trip to Japan! The program of the camp is summarized below: Day 1, July 16 Gather at the picturesque cottage village near the river. All cottages have bathroom and toilets. Shape the samurai knife under the guidance of Master Taro. Have a welcome dinner in the evening. Day 2, July 17 Start the day by cutting high-quality coal from the early morning before breakfast. Enjoy swimming in the river before forging the knife. Catch some fish from the river and cut it yourself with the knife you made! For lunch you will have oven-cooked piza, and for dinner - barbeque. Day 3, July 18 Clean your cottage after breakfast and prepare for departure. Up to 60 participants are welcome to join this camp. Multi-cultural interaction is welcome! Have fun and a wonderful 3-day adventure in Gifu's countryside! Access: Please arrive directly at the cottage village. From Gifu Station take the local Gifu bus on Gihoku line bound for Taniai. Get off at Taniai bus stop where your host will meet you.
strTitle: Join a Samurai Boot Camp and Make a Samurai Knife,July 16-18

strIntroduction: Take advantage of unique photo ops at Tsukiji Market while dressed in either a Japanese "yukata" (light kimono) or wearing kabuki makeup — or both! After donning this traditional costume, an informative guide leads you on a walk past numerous stalls at the world’s largest fish market. ◎Highlights -Tsukiji Market tour in traditional dress -Choose to wear kabuki makeup and/or yukata -Stroll through the market for fantastic photo ops! -Learn about Japanese traditions from a professional guide ◎What You Can Expect Enjoy Tsukiji! This tour includes walking around the largest fish market in the world, Tsukiji, Tokyo! You will have the option of wearing Kabuki makeup, a Traditional Japanese Yukata or both! Then you will be shown the Tsukiji area, then be free to eat lunch at a location of your choosing. Here is the tour: - Kabuki makeup You will arrive at our office and our staff will put Kabuki Makeup on you. It's an interesting process. - Put on Yukata You will then be assisted in putting the Yukata on. It's not simple clothes so getting assistance is definitely helpful. - Tour Tsukiji You will then explore the Tsukiji market. It's about 4 rows of back to back fish related stalls that make up the market and all are interesting. You are free at this time to also eat lunch at any of the locations in Tsukiji. Depending on how the tour goes you may also wish to see Ginza which is also near by. You will then return and remove makeup and Yukata. - Departure time 10 am-10 pm -Duration Yukata Rental 15 min/per person fitting time Return by 10:00 pm Kabuki make up 20 min/per person makeup application Return by 10:00 pm
strTitle: Tour Tsukiji Fish Market in Kabuki Makeup!

strIntroduction: Visit Nagano and join the Lake Suwa Fireworks Festival this summer! Lake Suwa fireworks is one of the biggest fireworks festivals in Japan, and the biggest fireworks festival in Nagano prefecture. You will see more than 40,000 fireworks launched on Lake Suwa at this mid summer fireworks festival, and you can enjoy the view of Suwa city area on the South side of the lake too. This program offers you two different courses with the following schedules: 1 Day Train Trip with spectator seats - Departing from Tachikawa, Hachiouji, or Shinjuku - Arrive in Kamisuwa Station - Arrive in Lake Suwa (You will have to pay the transportation fee from Kamiwa Station to Lake Suwa by yourself) - Lake Suwa Fireworks Festival - Arrive in Kamisuwa Station (You will have to pay the transportation fee from Lake Suwa to Kamiwa Station by yourself) - Departing from Kamisuwa Station by night train - Arrive in Shinjuku, Hachioji, or Tachikawa Station 2 Day Bus Trip to Lake Suwa Fireworks Festival and Kamikochi Day 1 - Departing from Shinjuku Tocho 10:00 - Arrive in Suwa Glass Museum - Lake Suwa Fireworks Festival - Arrive in Schole Hakuba 26:00 Day 2 - Depart from Schole Hakuba - Walk around Kamikochi for 2 hours and a half - Arrive in Shinjuku 21:00 You can choose either one of the programs to join the Lake Suwa Firework Festival in Nagano! Reservation is difficult to make, so we recommend you to use our service to book with no hassles! IMPORTANT: *This trip is available in Japanese only* - however we highly recommend this as a rare Japan experience that you can enjoy regardless of language.
strTitle: Visit Nagano and Join the Lake Suwa Fireworks Festival!

strIntroduction: The summer fireworks festivals, or hanabi (lit. fire flowers), originally meant to scare away evil spirits and are a major part of Japanese culture, not to be missed when you visit Japan. The Nagaoka Fireworks are held annually along the banks of the Shinano River over two nights in August and the finale covers about two kilometers of the river, the widest span of fireworks in the world! Getting a seat for this event is not easy, so these tours offer all the benefits of hassle-free arranged transportation and seats at the event! Option 1: by Shinkansen bullet train from Tokyo Station, Ueno or Omiya between 07:00 and 15:00 (state preference at time of booking). It takes around 30 mins on foot from Nagaoka Station to the hanabi site. After the event, it will take 60 mins to walk back to Nagaoka Station from where you will take the 23:15 train to Shiozawa station, arriving at 00:13. A shuttle bus will pick you up and take you to your hotel (either: Sateautel Shiozawa; Ipponsugi; or Yoshizato). Option 2: by coach bus from Shinjuku Station, departing 11:30. The coach bus will take you directly to the hanabi site. After the event, the bus will take you to your hotel (Hotel Green Plaza Joetsu), arriving after midnight. The following day, you will have some time for sightseeing before returning to Shinjuku at 16:30. This tour includes Koshihikari (rice brand) bento box for dinner on the first day. Departure: August 2 departure or August 3 departure. IMPORTANT: *This trip is available in Japanese only* - however we highly recommend this as a rare Japan experience that you can enjoy regardless of language.
strTitle: Enjoy a 2-Day Nagaoka Fireworks tour in Niigata, August 2-3!

strIntroduction: In this tour, you will be able to enjoy rafting on Kuma River. The river is popular amongst tourists; many people come to enjoy a ride on the river since it is considered to be one of the three most rapid rivers of Japan. You will be able to pick from the following three options: 1. Morning course Departing time: 9:00 (ends around 13:00) An exciting ride on rapid Kuma River. Party time included! Jumping into the river possible! 2. Afternoon course Departing time: 12:00 (ends around 16:00) An exciting ride on rapid Kuma River. Party time included! Jumping into the river possible! Note: The afternoon course takes you to faster rapids and more exciting rafting opportunities. 3. Full day course Departing time: 9:00 An exciting ride on rapid Kuma River. Party time included! Jumping into the river possible! Full day of water fun!
strTitle: Enjoy Rafting on Kuma River, in Kumamoto!

strIntroduction: This inspired Tokyo Food Tour will take guests from scenes in in the famous blockbuster movie, "Kill Bill", through the impressive Roppongi Hills property development and finishes on the bustling commercial street of Azabu-juban. At our first stop, we will enjoy a course lunch at the famous “Kill Bill Restaurant”, the restaurant that inspired director, Quentin Tarantino for the setting of the infamous fight scene where Uma Thurman (the Bride) took on the Tokyo gang called the Crazy 88s. Famous for it’s beautiful décor and great food, it has been visited by famous people such as George Bush, Johnny Depp, Sylvester Stallone, Henry Cavill and other notable individuals. Lunch includes salad, shrimp dumpling, shrimp and vegetable tempura, grilled fish, assortment of skewers, soba and dessert. After lunch we will walk towards the upscale Roppongi Hills, home to the 54-storey Mori Tower, Mori Art Museum and Tokyo City View observatory. Scattered around its landscape is public art such as Louise Bourgeois’ giant, spiny Maman spider sculpture and the benches-cum-sculptures along Keyakizaka-dōri, as well as the re-created Edo-style Mori Garden . After our stroll through Roppongi Hills, we will head down the popular Keiyakizaka street toward the ever-busy Azabu-juban Shotengai (Azabu-juban Commercial Street), one of the most popular foodie streets in the heart of the city filled with some of the most historic restaurants, bars and general stores. See places like Mamegen, a 140 year-old shop that sells 90 varieties of snacks and desserts ranging in taste from sweet, to spicy, to salty; and Karinto, a famous shop that sells around 50 flavor variations of karinto, a deep-fried snack made with brown sugar. Guests will also visit Agemochiya, well known for their appetizing, delicious and nicely wrapped rice crackers and Naniwaya, which serves very traditional taiyaki (fish-shaped griddlecakes traditionally filled with adzuki (sweet bean paste) that has a history of more than 100 years. You will have a chance to stop in each store and browse for some omiyage (souvenirs) as we end the tour near Azabu-juban Station where you can easily get to your next destination.
strTitle: Go on a Kill Bill Restaurant-Roppongi-Azabu Food Tour
Experience the Suigo Sawara Iris Festival, in Katori, Chiba

strIntroduction: Koiwai is a 7,400-acre farm located amid the scenic splendour at the base of Mt. Iwate. Famous for its dairy produce, Koiwai is a popular tourist destination, attracting around 750,000 visitors every year. Some of the farm buildings in the area, including silos and cowsheds, have been deemed National Tangible Cultural Properties. These buildings are just part of the lovely scenery at Koiwai and has been featured in a number of television dramas and feature films. On this guided bus tour (Japanese-speaking guide only), you will learn everything about Koiwai, explore dairy farms normally closed to the public, and see how the dairy products are made. When you enter the beautiful, expansive forest, your guide will tell you all about the diverse wildlife that live there. The meeting and ending point for this tour is at pastoral Makiba Park with its many attractions. Price includes admission, bus fare, Japanese-speaking guide, and fee. All major credit cards are accepted. • Add-on: Guided Kamimaru cattle barn admission - additional fee. Meeting and drop off point - Makiba Park. Duration: 70 minutes Start times: 09:30; 11:00; 13:00; and 14:30 daily (check in 10 mins beforehand) Access: Free parking available for 30 large buses and 2,300 standard cars. Arrivals by bullet train (Tohoku or Akita) or train (Tanzawa line), transfer to Bus at Morioka Station, platform 10 bound for "Koiwai Farm Makiba Park", or take the bus from Koiwai Station.
strTitle: Explore the Koiwai Farm and Forest by Bus, in Iwate!

strIntroduction: Enjoy this self-guided tour from Kumamoto by bus. In Nagasaki, you will stay at a comfortable, clean and modern Nagasaki Bus Terminal Hotel.The hotel is perfectly located to explore Chinatown, one of the largest in Japan. You'll be able to browse the fascinating shops and restaurants of this vibrant, colourful area. There are also classic shopping arcades of the historic Dejima area where you can find souvenirs to take home. The hotel also makes for a great base from which to explore this amazing city to your own personal agenda, pace, and interests. For example, this great budget package is equally ideal for experiencing the nightlife in Nagasaki, or viewing the city from the top of the hills. While in Nagasaki, you should also try the local noodle dishes: champon and sara udon! With so many cultural and gastronomic delights to offer, Nagasaki is a great place to visit. Of course, visitors to the city are always encouraged to visit the Nagasaki Peace Park to consider the futility of human conflicts, and the horror this has led to in the past. Far from being a depressing and unsettling experience, this permanent exhibition and memorial, and indeed the city of Nagasaki itself, is a testament to hope and renewal in a spirit of peace and harmony.
strTitle: Experience a Self-Guided Tour of Nagasaki, for Solo Traveler

strIntroduction: Ikuta Ryokuchi Park Tour Ikuta Ryokuchi Park is one of the most cherished park areas in all of Kawasaki. Surrounded by small woods made up of various oaks, Ikuta Park is located in the gently undulating Tama Hills. There are some facilities such as Japan Open Air Folk House Museum and Taro Okamoto Museum and so on in the park. Even if you don't enter those facilities, you can enjoy hiking and seeing the nature. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Itinerary 11:00 am - Meet up at Mukogaoka-yuen 11:30 am - Japan Open Air Folk House Museum 00:30 pm - Lunch (Japanese Soba) 02:30 pm - Indigo dying 03:30 pm - Taro Okamoto Museum of Art 05:30 pm - Dinner (Hiroshima Style Okonomiyaki) 07:00 pm - End of the tour *The itinerary is not fixed except meeting time and Indigo dying. *You can change dinner if you want. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- After meeting up, we will visit the Japan Open Air Folk House Museum. There are 25 buildings from the Edo Period (1603-1867) which were relocated to Kawasaki from all over Japan. Many of them have been designated as important cultural properties by the government. You can see what traditional Japanese houses look like and how old Japanese people lived. We will eat Japanese Soba (buckwheat) noodles for lunch made with spring water from Oshino Village in Yamanashi prefecture. [Menu] Minkaen-soba (Hot soba with three mix on top) : 800 JPY Sansai-soba (Hot soba with wild vegetable) : 650 JPY Tororo-soba (Hot soba with grated yam) : 700 JPY Nameko-soba (Hot soba with nameko mushrooms) : 700 JPY Tanuki-soba (Hot soba with tempara crumbs) : 650 JPY Mori-soba (Cold soba) : 600 JPY Hiyashi-tororo-soba (Cold soba with grated yam) : 630 JPY You can try indigo dyeing using a plain handkerchief. It's easy even if it is your first experience. It takes 30 minutes to an hour. [Charges] A plain handkerchief : 600 JPY A tie-dyed handkerchief : 900 JPY A tie-dyed shop curtain (noren) S size : 1,500 JPY A tie-dyed shop curtain L size : 3,000 JPY You can also enjoy creative dyeing with your goods brought in. [Charges] 15 JPY per 1 gram of cloth [Examples] A handkerchief (weighs about 20 grams) : 300 JPY A Japanese hand towel (40 grams) : 600 JPY A T-shirt (120 grams) : 1800 JPY The Taro Okamoto Museum of Art mainly collects and preserves the works of Taro Okamoto, and his parents Kanoko and Ippei. Taro is very famous artist in Japan especially for creating "Tower of the Sun" which became the symbol of Expo'70 in Osaka, 1970. I won't go inside the museum, so enjoy his works to your heart's content. [Admission] Permanent exhibition - Regular 500 JPY, Concession : 300 JPY Temporary exhibition - varies according to exhibition At the end of the tour, we will eat Hiroshima Style Okonomiyaki for dinner at the local restaurant. Okonomiyaki is a Japanese savoury pancake containing a variety of ingredients. Hiroshima Style Okonomiyaki is characterized by containing noodles. The ingredients are layered rather than mixed in Hiroshima. A restaurant can be changed if you want. Please feel free to ask me. Let's enjoy the tour together!
strTitle: Explore Ikuta Ryokuchi Park in Kawasaki

strIntroduction: We start the class by introducing all basic Japanese ingredients that are necessary in making authentic Japanese flavour. You will get a chance to see and even taste the key ingredients used in everyday cooking. Once you're familiar with the ingredients, we will proceed in making dashi (soup stock) or miso teaching you the traditional way of doing it. In the class , we will make three side dishes, an all time favourite is Tamagoyaki which is the Japanese egg roll. We will give a hands-on experience in making this very delicious side dish. The other two side dishes depend on what kind of ingredients are in season, we use only the freshest ingredients . The last part is making the main dish, we have a great selection of main dishes from Tonkatsu, Tempura, Nikujyaga (Japanese beef stew), Shogayaki (Pork with ginger), Grilled Fish with miso, Chicken Teriyaki, Yakisoba, Sukiyaki, Shabu-Shabu etc. This course includes some delicious wagashi (Japanese dessert) and Japanese tea. All recipes in English will be handed out at the end of each class.
strTitle: Enjoy a Japanese Home cooking classes in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Let's take a walk through Tokyo's emotional cityscape wearing a kimono or yukata! I will prepare the clothes (yukata in summer) for this 3-hour tour. Male yukata is also available. Below is the schedule of the activity: 1) I bring the kimono to your hotel. You can wear it. (around 30 min) 2) We will go to the place of the meeting with the photographer. The recommended place is Kagurazaka and Asakusa. 3) The photographer takes your pictures. Photography time is 30 minutes 4) Let's eat a lunch in a staff recommended restaurant! I rent the kimono for a full day. I will deliver the data and a framed photo on the next day at your hotel. Staff members who live in Kagurazaka and Asakusa will guide you. Please enjoy this pleasant tour!
strTitle: Tour Tokyo in Kimono or Yukata with a Photographer

strIntroduction: Incense has been an essential part of Japan's religious and daily life for centuries. These Monko workshops teach appreciation of incense. Participants are asked not to wear any perfumes. Monko workshop: Experience the distinctive fragrances of high-grade incense woods. Learn to 'listen' to incense and distinguish fragrances. For 2 to 5 people. Schedule: Monday - Saturday, 10:30 a.m. and 2:30 p.m. Approx. 45 min. duration. Monko Practice Workshop: Experience the entire Monko process, from preparing the censer to burning the Incense wood. For 2 to 4 people. Schedule: Monday - Saturday, 10:30 a.m. and 2:30 p.m. Approx. 60 min. duration. Genji Incense Workshop: participate in a sophisticated game, determining which of five censers have the same fragrance. Green tea and sweets will be served! For reserved groups of 5 or more. Schedule: Monday - Friday, 2:30 p.m. Approx. 90 min. duration Scented Sachet Workshop: Learn to mix ingredients to create your own original fragrance. The natural ingredients keep insects away, so scented sachets are often put in drawers and wardrobes. For 2 to 40 people. Schedule: Monday - Friday, 2:30 p.m. Approx. 45 min. duration. Kneaded Incense Workshop: Learn to mix ingredients to create your own original kneaded incense. You can take away the kneaded incense you make in the workshop and enjoy burning it at home. For 2 to 40 people. Schedule: Monday - Friday, 2:30 p.m. Approx. 45 min. duration.
strTitle: Listen to Incense or Join an Incense Making Course in Kyoto

strIntroduction: This is a one hour long panoramic bus tour in an open top bus of Fukuoka. The buses have been specially designed to allow for maximum comfort and best possible viewing of the sights. Enjoy all the amazing sights Fukuoka has to offer from the comfort of your seat and feel the wind and sun as you make your way through historic sights, breathtaking views and Fukuoka's landmarks. There are three routes available: The seaside route takes on the metropolitan highway that runs along the beach for spectacular views of The Fukuoka Yahoo! Dome, the Fukuoka Tower and many more famous spots! Departure time: 9:30, 11:30, 15:00, 17:00, 18:00 The Hakata route will give you a historic overview of the city, and you will be able to see the Kujida shrine, as well as other historical relics of Fukuoka. Perfect for history buffs! Departure time: 10:00, 12:00, 15:30 The Fukuoka night view route takes you on the metropolitan highway in the evening and allows you to take in the night view as you drive past landmarks such as the Fukuoka tower. Departure time: 19:30, 20:00 By purchasing any route of this bus tour, you'll also be able to ride as many times as you want on that day on regular buses in the designated central area of Fukuoka. Don't miss the chance to enjoy Fukuoka in a unique and convenient way!
strTitle: Enjoy Fukuoka's amazing sights with an open top bus tour

strIntroduction: This is a trip to Shimokita Peninsula in Aomori prefecture, Japan. The trip will start at 9 am and finish at 7 pm. I will pick you up at Shichinohe-Towada Shinkansen Station at 9 am. We will drive along coastal roads and through the forests to one of the three holiest temples in Japan. The drive is 2 hours through scenic and remote landscapes. Here we will walk through a hellish smoking landscape near an acidic lake surround by a lotus flower shaped set of mountains. Enter Bodaiji Temple and get a closer look at Japanese Buddhism. This temple is a thousand years old and the entrance to the afterlife making it very important. You will see many Jizo statues. Jizo is the Bodhisattva of hell and guardian of children. Outside of the temple is a small restaurant where we will have lunch from 12:00 to 1:00. Afterward we will bathe in a traditional bathouse at the temple from 1:00 - 1:30 pm. The bathouses are constructed out of wood and have a sulfuric smell. This is an excellent chance to interact with Japanese people as people tend to be very relaxed and talkative. There is often a chance to view a traditional Buddhist ceremony with drums and chanting from 2:00 - 2:15 pm. After bathing and possibly seeing the ceremony we will take a short drive to Yagen Valley from 2:30 - 3:00 pm. Here we can take a walk down a picturesque mountain stream with waterfalls and also visit an outdoor mountain bath called Kappa Yu. A Kappa is a mischievous Japanese forest spirit and he resides in the rivers of Yagen Valley. We will round up the tour with a scenic drive back to Shichinohe-Towada Shinkansen Station. Catch the train to Aomori at 7:22 pm. The trip can be a private tour or shared as a group.
strTitle: Explore Aomori's Lush Forests, Mountain Bathhouses, Temples!

strIntroduction: This is a tour to Aomori prefecture's countryside with a visit to the famous Oirase Gorge near Lake Towada. The river valley path winds along the river and affords spectacular views of over a dozen waterfalls and many interesting rock formations. The water is crystal clear and the green forest surrounds you and cools you as you walk in the clean mountain air. After walking we will take a short drive to Sukayu Onsen, a 300 year old traditional bathhouse. The water comes straight out of the ground and is contained in a large cypress bath. The bathhouse is mixed bathing separated by a rope throughout the middle of the bath. There is also a single gender bath. After bathing we will take a walk around the volcanic area and botanical gardens with Hakkoda mountains looming over us. This is a spectacular place and one very far off the beaten track. Itinerary of the tour: Shichinohe-Towada Shinkansen Station Pick up: 9:00 AM Scenic Driver through Rural Japan and Winding Mountain Roads: 9:15 - 10:30 (bus to start of walk 280 JPY) Walk through Oirase Gorge/Waterfall Viewing: 10:30 - 1:30 pm View by a dozen magestic waterfalls along a smooth and easy walking path through a beautiful forest. Walk 2-4 kilometers one way in 2.5 hours. Lunch at Yakeyama Restaraunt: 1:30 - 2:30 pm Drive to Sukayu Onsen: 2:30 - 3:15 p, Sukayo Onsen Bathe in Mixed or Single Gender Onsen baths: 3:15 - 4:15 pm Explore Volcanic Activity Zone around the Onsen: 4:15 - 5:15 pm Return to Shichinohe-Towada Shinkansen Station: 5:15 - 6:10 pm If headed to Aomori city you will catch the Shinkansen at 6:27 pm. If headed to Tokyo you will catch the Shinkansen at 6:53 pm. Staying an evening at the Onsen is possible for an additional fee and subject to availability.
strTitle: See Aomori's Waterfalls and 300-Year-Old Mountain Hot Spring

strIntroduction: Okonomiyaki is known as a kind of Japanese-style pancakes or pizza. As “okonomi” means “what you like” or “what you want”, you can add your favorite ingredients in okonomiyaki. Okonomiyaki is usually made from egg, flour, water, small shrimp, squid, and chopped cabbage. (Monja is a kind of Okonomiyaki) The Okonomiyaki ＆ Monja shop I'm going to take you to is near Tsukishima (月島）Station in Tokyo. We will meet at Tsukishima Station and go along the Monja street. Choose the kind of okonomiyaki you like, and I will show you how to make it on the big iron plate! Then you can eat it! There are 75 Monja shops along the Monja street. I'll take care of the reservation in advance. Please book in advance and enjoy it!
strTitle: Learn how to make Okonomiyaki & Monja in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Located at the base of Mt Yatsugatake, Kiyosato Plateau is a popular summer resort in Yamanashi Prefecture. In this one day bus tour, we will take you to Kiyosato Kogen Hotel for lunch, where you'l have a delicious course menu. And at Makiba Restaurant, you will be able to purchase delicious cookies and fruit jams as souvenirs, and will receive a small ice cream snack. You will then head to a blueberry farm for blueberry picking and "all-you-can-eat"! After enjoying the fresh air, we will head to Chateau Katsunuma Winery where you'll be able to taste Japanese wine. Finally, go to another farm and pick 2 peaches per person! Fruits picking is one of the highlights of visiting Yamanashi, so be sure to enjoy fully the day in the sunny nature of Yamanashi! Itinerary: -Depart from Shinjuku at 8:00 - Take the expressway bus. (*On May 3rd, 4th, 5th, depart at 7:30) - Makiba Restaurant (shopping and ice cream) -Kiyosato Kogen Hotel (Enjoy lunch of western dishes) - Blueberry picking (eat as many as you can) - Chateau Katsunuma Winery (Taste Japanese wine) - Peach picking (two pieces per person) -Bus to Shinjuku, End of tour (Scheduled 19:00)
strTitle: Enjoy fruits picking & lunch in Kiyosato Kogen in Yamanashi!

strIntroduction: 2 Days Limited Tour only available on April 25th & 28th!! This is a 1-Day bus tour going to Mt. Fuji Shibazakura Festival from Shinjuku, Tokyo. You may also visit Lake Kawaguchi and Mt.Fuji, so it's definitely worth joining! In this tour, you will meet your guide in the morning at Shinjuku, Tokyo, and take the bus to visit Lake Kawaguchi, Fuji Shibazakura (Moss Phlox) Festival, Mt. Fuji 5th station, and return to Shinjuku in the afternoon. When you arrive at Yamanashi prefecture, you will first visit Lake Kawaguchi, which is one of Fuji Five Lakes and is the gateway to Mt. Fuji. Enjoy the natural reflection of Mt. Fuji! After that, here comes the main purpose of the tour, Fuji Shibazakura Festival. Shibazakura is also known as Moss Phlox and you may observe about 800,000 of them! It is a festival of flowers which gives color to Mt.Fuji through contrast with their gorgeous colors. Since lunch is not included in this tour, you are free to eat your own lunch at the festival. Then, you will go to Mt.Fuji 5th Station and get the closest view of Mt. Fuji. There is also a Shinto shrine so you may visit it too. There are so many special things about this tour! Firstly, you can enjoy not only the Shibazakura Festival but also places like Lake Kawaguchi and Mt.Fuji 5th Station. Even for the local Japanese it is not so easy to go to these places from Tokyo, so we definitely recommend you and it's a must-try tour! Secondly, multilingual audio guidance is available for this tour, including 6 languages such as English, Spanish, French, Italy, Chinese and Thai. Even if you don't understand Japanese, there's no need to worry about it! In addition, there will be an English tour guide too so you may ask them anything you want. Thirdly, free Wi-Fi service is available on the bus. After the arrival, if you would like to take a shot of the festival or share your selfie with the beautiful Shibazakura, you can instantly send messages to your friends and show off! There are many other special offers for this tour, so don't miss this opportunity to experience this valuable activity! This tour is only available on April 25th & 28th. Itinery: 08:00 Meet your guide at ""LOVE"" monument at Shinjuku You will depart at 08:30. Via Tokyo Metropolitan Expressway & Chuo Expressway 10:05 - 10:30 Lake Kawaguchi Enjoy the natural reflecting pool for Mt. Fuji ! 11:15 - 13:00 Fuji Shibazakura Festival Take your lunch here with the beautiful view of 800,000 of Shibazakura! 14:30 - 15:00 Mt.Fuji 5th Station Get the closest view of Mt. Fuji! 17:00 - 17:30 Return to Shinjuku Station. Please go to your next destination on your own.
strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day Bus tour to Mt.Fuji Shibazakura from Tokyo

strIntroduction: Ise Jingu is visited by many people from times immemorial and is a famous traditional spot. It is said to be an energy ”power spot”. This means it's a spiritual spot. Ise Jingu is large and is surrounded by many trees. You can heal your spirit there. Ise Jingu is divided into two areas: Naiku (Inner Shrine) and Geku (Outer Shrine). We will go to both in this tour. Below are the details of the itinerary: 10:00: Meet at Kintetsu Iseshi Station. Iseshi Station can be reached on Kintetsu train from Nagoya. (The train fee from Nagoya to Iseshi Station is not included in the tour price) Go to Ise Jingu Geku. Walk around the shrine. 11:00: Go to Ise Naiku by my car. 11:30: See Ise Jingu Naiku. This shrine is bigger and is visited by more people. 12:30: Walk around Okage-yokocho shopping street. Buy foods and souvenirs. This tour doesn't include lunch. But you can buy many local foods there. Some of them you can eat only there. 13:30: Go to see the famous "husband and wife" rocks at Futami-okitama Shrine. The rocks are in a line as if they are a husband and wife. The scenery is pretty with the sea surrounding the rocks. 14:30: Leave Futami-okitama Shrine. Go to Uji-Yamada Station. 15:00: End of tour Please let me know if you have other preferences for the time schedule.
strTitle: See the highlights of Ise Jingu on a private guided tour

strIntroduction: The is a historical bus tour where you can explore Koiwai Farm guided by amazing staff actually working on the farm. Many places are usually not open for visitors, so don't miss this opportunity to uncover the hidden secrets a farm with over 120 years of history! Koiwai Farm was opened in 1891 and is one of the most historical dairy products maker in Japan. They offer this tour to show and tell the guests how exciting the “dairy farming, forestry, service” are. The total farm space is approx. 3000 ha, which is twice as big as Haneda Airport. The tour guide will introduce Koiwai Farm’s history, what kind of things they’re doing, scenery from the farm, and more with their official uniform which continues to be worn from the Meiji era. The staff at Koiwai Farms work using traditional methods while also implementing environmentally innovative initiatives. Moreover, it is a great chance to see a sustainable forest which is very rare in Japan. It is an exciting tour where you can see a “real” farm and feel the atmosphere of the active livestock business! We recommend this tour to guests who are interested in attending academic tours such as visiting museums or guests who love to take photos! There are many photo shooting spots to enjoy the seasonal scenery of Koiwai Farm. This tour is available during April 15th to November 6th. Itinerary: Meet your guide in front of the set up tent at Makibaen in Koiwai Farm ※You have 4 options for the meeting time. 09:30 / 11:00 / 13:00 / 14:30 You will visit: -Main Office -Old Amihari Highway -Warehouse -Tsurugadai Cowshed -Biomass Power “Shizuku-ishi” -Natural Refrigerator -Kamimaru Cowshed -See the only cherry blossom tree in Koiwai Farm -Bushes of Koiwai Farm This tour ends at the point of departure.
strTitle: Enjoy Guided Bus Tour of Koiwai Farm in Iwate, Tohoku!

strIntroduction: We have a special tour for you: All-you-can-eat “Biwa” loquat and melon, and great views of a rice terrace and Tokyo Bay. You start in Tokyo in the morning and come back to Tokyo in the evening. Relish fresh fruits at the best of the season! See the traditional rice terrace which the local farmers have sown from generation to generation. Enjoy the rural landscape where rice terraces spread across the hillsides of mountains. Wearing clothes and shoes that let you move easily and comfortably is strongly recommended. The basic schedule: Shinjuku, Ueno, or Tokyo station: 8:50 Hachimitsu Kobo honey factory (Rest, 20 minutes) Mt. Nokogiri (Enjoy the views of Tokyo Bay, 30 minutes) Tomiura (All-you-can-eat “Biwa” loquat & melon, 30 minutes/Shopping, 20 minutes – 50 minutes in total) Oyama Rice Terrace (Visit the rice terrace in fresh green, 40 minutes) Shinjuku, Ueno, or Tokyo station: 17:00 – 18:00 Departure date and place: Shinjuku: May 14, 22 Ueno: May 15 Tokyo (station): May 21 * Fee includes a bus seat, all-you-can-eat loquat, and all-you-can-eat melon. The following conditions will apply: * The minimum number of participants for operation is 25. * You are required to check in at least 10 minutes before your scheduled tour departure. * There is no restroom on the bus, so please go to the restroom before you get on the bus. * A tour conductor or staff of your preferred language will accompany the tour from the designated meeting place and provide the participant with basic information necessary for the tour (such as meeting place and time at each stop) in your preferred language. Information on sightseeing in the areas of tour destinations will not be provided. However, brochures in your preferred language will be provided. * Children 6 years old and above can participate in this activity. * Please be sure to protect yourself against hot and cold weather. * If we have to cancel the tour due to typhoon, heavy snow, or other circumstances beyond our control, we will decide the cancellation by 3 pm Japan Standard Time one day before the departure, and inform you about it by email. * You can bring PET bottles, thermos bottles, and beverages in containers with a lid on the bus. * You cannot take your pets with you.
strTitle: Enjoy All-You-Can-Eat Loquat and Melon in Chiba!

strIntroduction: Wear samurai clothes “iaidogi”. Strike a samurai pose with a Japanese sword in an old temple near Osaka.
