Below is the summary of the activity: (held 4 times per a day) Part 1: (30 min, 10:00-10:30, 12:00-12:30, 14:00-14:30, 16:00-16:30) Wear clothes "iaidogi"and "hakama" clothes. Part 2: (30 min, 10:30-11:00, 12:30-13:00, 14:30-15:00, 16:30-17:00) See the old temples. Pose like a samurai with a Japanese sword. Time schedule: The time for one session is about 1 hours. Choose between one of the slots below: 1st: start 10:00 - end 11:00 2nd: start 12:00 - end 13:00 3rd: start 14:00 - end 15:00 4th: start 16:00 - end 17:00 Address: 1141 Shindachi ichiba Sennan Osaka Japan 〒590-0504
strTitle: Strike a samurai pose with Japanese swords, Osaka

strIntroduction: This is a group tour for up to 8 people. Below is the itinerary of the tour: 10:25: Meeting at Tsukiji Shijo Station (close to the main gate of Tsukiji Market) 10:30: Strolling the inner market, fish and seafood section - learn about Tsukiji, fish and seafood in general, or the best fish and seafood in all seasons - witness wonders you can see only in Tsukiji Market - mingle with the worker's colleagues 11:00: Strolling Uogashi-yokocho - visit some stores including a cooking knife store where the guide sometimes visits to buy or amend his shop's knives - try some snacks during the tour if you are hungry. We can find Japanese omelettes, a famous Japanese sweets shop (dango, Japanese dumpling) whose dango are favourite among Tsukiji's workers. 11:30: Namiyoke shrine - visit a special shrine for all Tuskiji workers. The guide bows every time he passes by. 11:40: Question time - please ask the guide whatever you want: about lunch spots or where to go during your stay! We want to help you as much as we can, like I was helped in many countries where I have traveled. 12:00: End of tour
strTitle: Take a quick Tsukiji tour guided by a Tsukiji market worker!

strIntroduction: I offer the exquisite Japanese cuisine and sushi course in one of the locally popular hideaway restaurants in Tsukiji, Tokyo. One English-speaking local will be included in this course as the chef and his wife are not English speakers. He/she will help deepen your dining experience. The chef is well informed about sake, Japanese distilled liquor (shochu), etc. Please dive into this profound Japanese cuisine world! Time & Date Mon - Fri: 18:00 - 22:00 Sat: 17:30 - 21:00 Meeting Point Tsukiji Station *or, we can arrange pick-up at another place according to your travel schedule (the transportation fee is not included) Schedule 17:30 - 19:00 meet up at Tsukiji Station 17:40 - 19:10 Japanese cuisine and sushi course starts You can stay there until the closing time. Menu Description The chef goes to Tsukiji Fish Market every day to choose the best vegetables, fish and seafood in the season. Unlike pre-made food chain store, the menu changes day by day. Before sushi, dishes for paring with sake are mainly served. =Below seasonal dishes are examples= *Every season -cream cheese pickled with Japanese sake leeks Japanese sake leeks deepen and make cream cheese more tasty, which is one of this restaurant's specialty. Enjoy the amazing combination with Japanese sake. *Winter only -foie gras of the sea, Ankimo (steamed Monkfish liver) Unlike foie gras, it is natural, good for heath, and full of nutrition. Sake and Ankimo make one of the best couples in Japan! :) NOTICE: * +16 year-old only * Please let me know if you have any allergies * Group tour (max. 8 people) * Raw fish and seafood (shrimp, clams etc) are included in this course. So I don't recommend this course for strict vegetarian * Any food request is welcome（Do you have any dietary restrictions like Halal? Please let me know） * Depending on the availability, this tour would not be held or I can recommend another local hideaway restaurant near Tsukiji * Meeting time will be fixed according to your schedule. Please contact us.
strTitle: Feel like a local at a secret hideaway restaurant in Tsukiji

strIntroduction: *This is a group tour* 10:00: Meet at Tsukiji-Shijo Station 10:10: Stroll the inner market and Uogashi Yokocho - visit the inner market and its shops for vegetables, cooking knives, Japanese cooking instruments or kitchenware for shopping. - if you are hungry, you can try Japanese omelette or dumplings famous in Tsukiji *The inner market might be closed according to the market calendar. In this case, we will explore Uogashi Yokocho further. 10:40: Namiyoke Shrine, a special shrine for Tsukiji's working people 11:00: Move to Ningyocho by subway - you may be surprised and ask "why leave Tsukiji before lunch!?". But actually working people in Tsukiji usually don't have a meal there. Instead, I will bring you to Ningyocho, where you ill find many delicious quiet restaurants in a relaxing atmosphere, without any queue. 11:20: Strolling and lunch - drop by some famous Japanese sweets shop for souvenirs, tea shop, Tofu shops, Taiyaki shops, Ningyo-yaki shops, Senbei (rice crackers) shops, etc. - we have many choices for lunch there: ramen, sushi, Japanese cuisine, Oyako-don (a rice bowl topped with cooked chicken covered by half-cooked egg), sukiyaki, grilled fish pickled with sake lees, etc. If you don't have any preference, please follow me! 13:00: End of tour (after tour, if you want to have a tea break near here, I have many recommendations. Ningyocho is famous for cafes too!)
strTitle: Explore Tsukiji like a pro-buyer & have a fancy sushi lunch!

strIntroduction: Save the long early queue for fight day tickets. If you have come all the way to Japan but missed out on the chance to watch sumo, this just might be your last chance to catch a glimpse of Japan's most famous traditional sport. With pre-ordered ticket prices ranging from 5,000 - 40,000 JPY for each day of the Tokyo Sumo Championship Tournament, sumo can be very expensive. Add to that the fact that most tickets are sold out as early as a month before each tournament, watching live sumo in Japan is a real rarity. Tokyo's Sumo Championship is also only available 3 times a year running for a total of only 45 days out of the 356 days in the year, making sumo a highly unique experience that few that come to Japan will ever get the chance to see. With this service you can buy the “Fight Day" tickets to become one of the lucky few to watch real Japanese Sumo Wrestlers fighting for a Championship Trophy. The price changes due to popularity of the tickets which depends on each day. The last day ticket for example is hugely popular and very difficult to get. ===================== IMPORTANT INFORMATION ===================== -Seats are located in the 2nd floor furthest from the ring. -Cancellation only acceptable 2 days before the day the ticket is for. -Ticket face value is only 2,200 JPY (our price is for the service.) -Pick up your ticket close to the Sumo Championship Site on the same day as your ticket will be used. -We can not assure you that we will be able to purchase the tickets, you will be fully refunded if we are unable to purchase your tickets. -If we can purchase your tickets we will contact you on the reservation morning between 9:30-10:30 so you will need to provide a contact e-mail address and if possible telephone number, so that you can receive the ticket-pick-up meeting point data. -If you reserve more than 1 ticket there is a chance that we cannot purchase all tickets, but you will still need to pay for the those tickets. There will be no refund for tickets that have already been purchased.
strTitle: Last Chance Fight Day Tokyo Sumo Championship Tickets!

strIntroduction: Nagano and Yamanashi have many beautiful places to enjoy viewing cherry blossoms and many people from all around Japan visit Nagano and Yamanashi for hanami. Takato Joshi Koen (Takato Castle Ruins Park, Takato Castle Site Park) is reputedly one of the three best locations to see cherry blossoms in Japan, along with Hirosaki Castle and Yoshinoyama. The park is located on a hill in Ina City of Nagano Prefecture about 60 kilometers south of Matsumoto. There are about 1500 cherry trees of the pinkish Kohigan variety around the park providing great cherry blossom views each spring. The Kohigan cherry trees are said to have been planted here in 1875 when the park was first opened to the public. Yamanashi Togenkyo (Peach Blossom Paradise) is one of the most famous peach-producing areas in Japan and there are vast peach fields spread around the whole area. As the flat land does not have much change in elevation, once the peach blossoms start blooming, the scenery becomes like a new world covered with a pink carpet. Every year, peach blossoms start blooming in early April and they spread gradually to the higher altitude and there are many spots where you can enjoy the great scenery of the peach fields. You start in Tokyo and come back to Tokyo. Wear clothes and shoes comfortable to walk in. The one-day bus tour is held in the following order: Start at Shinjuku Station (7:00) Shopping at Oginoya Suwa Ten (Lunch time) Takato Joshi Koen Yamanashi Togenkyo Come back to Shinjuku Station (Around 19:00) * The order may change. * The bus may be delayed due to the traffic conditions. * If the peach blossom season has passed its peak, the bus will take you to Chateraise Belle-Foret Winery instead. **The price differs depending on the date. * Admission fee to Takato Joshi Koen is included. * Lunch is not included. Ohanami bentoh with tea or Oginoya Kamameshi without tea can be prepared (1,000 JPY including tax for each). If you need it, apply for it when reserving the tour, and make payment in the tour by cash. * Free for infants aged 5 or under.
strTitle: Enjoy a Cherry Blossom Tour in Nagano and Yamanashi!

strIntroduction: Meeting you outside the East Exist of Kamakura station our food guide will account for all guests before departing. You will start the tour by walking towards Danzakura, a long walking pathway between the Nino Torii Gate and the San'no Torii Gate. A Torii Gate is an important part of Japanese culture and Shinto religion. It marks the approach and entrance to a Shinto shrine and also the division between the physical and spiritual worlds. Danzakura is a raised path lined with cherry trees and looks particularly splendid in the spring when everything begins to bloom. Alongside are very famous restaurants, food shops we will be able to make stops at. Our first stop is a local store that specializes in side dishes and pickles. Sampling most items will be free to try for our guests. After some samplings, we will be walking towards the beautiful Sanno Tori Gate, the spiritual entrance to Tsurugaoka Hachimangu, the most important Shinto shrine in the city of Kamakura. The shrine is at the geographical and cultural center of the city of Kamakura. After our approach we will sit down for a beautifully arranged traditional Japanese lunch where our foodie will further detail the rich tradition and history behind some of the most local Japanese cuisines as well as manners of eating them. The next stop is Komachi Dori a street lined with over 250 restaurants, boutiques, fancy cafes, Japanese-style sweet cafes, and stores unique to the ancient city. Sample some local snacks in this very busy street. End off the tour with an amazing Japanese Dessert served with green tea in a beautiful ancient Japanese garden house.
strTitle: Embark on a Walking Food Tour in Kamakura!

strIntroduction: Get picked up at your hotel or meet at a designated station in Nagoya, and let's start the tour! We will guide you to some good places based on your request and preferences. We will drive or take you to our apartment where we will serve you Japanese foods which we can make ourselves! While making the food, you can enjoy the atmosphere of a typical Japanese apartment. Note: If your time is limited, we can have our food ready in advance. Please choose among the food examples from the list: - Chirashi-zushi (sushi rice in a bowl with a variety of ingredients ) - Sukiyaki (thin slices of beef with various vegetables) - Takoyaki oOctopus dumplings) - Okonomiyaki (a meat, seafood, and vegetable pancake) We will do our best to serve your requested Japanese foods! This experience is conducted by two local hosts in Nagoya (Shoichi and Kanako).
strTitle: Nagoya customized tour with home-made traditional dishes

strIntroduction: This is an all-night tour for people who want to party in Tokyo during their visit! Below is the detailed itinerary of the tour: 11:00 pm: Gather at Roppongi 11:30 pm: Have some drinks at a Japanese sake bar (Izakaya) 12:30 am: Take a train and go to the nightclub 1:00 am: Enter the nightclub 4:30 am: Have a breakfast if you want to 5:00 am: End of the tour, go back to your hotel by taxi Be ready to party wild all night with us!!
strTitle: Party all Night on this Amazing Nightlife Tour in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: You cannot spot any modish girl in the city without a perfect and well-cared manicure. Whether it is do-it-yourself at home or enjoy a comfortable service in the beauty salon, they always treat the nails with hundreds of choices in designs and colors in Tokyo. Being new here and love to join the popular kawaii (cute) culture in Japan? It is best to have your manicure taken care of. With the latest nail technology, you can have high quality gel nail application, free choice of design and color combination, have twinkling stones and stickers lasting up to 3-4 weeks. Compared to the common manicure, a gel nail treatment is faster and easier to apply and promises longer durability. Moreover, the service also comes with free fix to the decorative materials. And please enjoy the most comfort during the nail application with our English translator accompanied. However, children under 15 years old are not allowed. An additional surcharge will have to be paid on the day for old gel removal. The nail shop only operates from 10 AM - 5 PM.
strTitle: Try on Japanese Kawaii Nail Art in Tokyo

strIntroduction: **This special workshop will be held on May 21 and May 22, 2016 only. Do you know what Japanese traditional Urushi lacquer is? Many people have misgivings about Urushi lacquers based on the fact that they can cause allergic reactions and take a long time to dry. With accurate knowledge, Urushi lacquer can be handled by amateurs at home too. This is an art form with a variety of applications. Urushi has a history of over 9000 years and is 100% ecological. Urushi is famous for being used in the restoration of national treasures such as Kinkakuji Temple in Kyoto (“The Golden Pavilion”). This is a rare opportunity for English speaking students to learn the mysterious and fascinating Urushi art forms by practicing them in our studio! A Japanese instructor will be translated from Japanese to English on the spot!!
strTitle: Participate in an Urushi Art Workshop for beginners in May

strIntroduction: The Tour starts at the meet up point in Shimbashi. Enjoy the beautiful scenery of Tokyo River and Odaiba, a set of small man-made fort islands (daiba literally means "fort"), which were built towards the end of the Edo Period as you take the monorail to head towards Daiba Station. Upon arrival, you will walk through some of the most breath taking sceneries of Tokyo, then Head to Aqua City for some local Japanese lunch that most locals enjoy to eat - the meals are very healthy and delicious. After this, we will walk around a small ramen museum where ramen from different places in Japan with different kinds of broths and noodles can be seen. We will proceed to the beautiful Diver's City Tokyo Plaza - a diverse, buzz-creating new landmark of Tokyo in one of Japan’s most popular sightseeing spots. This is also home to some very new and trendy dessert and snack places that are very famous even with locals such as the Hello Kitty Cafe, Gundam Cafe, Calbee Potato Shop, etc. End the trip by enjoy some refreshing drinks and desserts while savouring the beautiful view of Odaiba!
strTitle: Explore Odaiba on a Walking Food Tour

strIntroduction: We start by making the perfect sushi rice, a key element to enhance the taste. We then explain the fundamental elements of Japanese home cooking which is your first chance to see, feel and even taste some of the ingredients we will be using. Sprinkled into the preparation and cooking we touch on some history, traditional etiquette, and other fun facts to help paint a more complete picture of the traditions you are learning. Our classes are fun, informative and engaging-a very personal experience where you can ask everything that you want to know about sushi and maki. The flower mosaic sushi and temari sushi are absolutely delicious and gorgeous-they're almost too beautiful to eat. This course will definitely give you some skill that you can take back home with you-an unforgettable experience that you will surely be able to enjoy and put into practice. You will be able recreate your favourite sushi/rolls,even much more beautiful and yummier than those you see at any Japanese restaurants. Our Sushi and Maki Lunch Course is served with two side dishes, Osuimono (Clear Broth Soup), Japanese Wagashi (Dessert) and green tea.
strTitle: Make your own Flower Mosaic Sushi & Temari Sushi

strIntroduction: Between the end of March and the beginning of April, just during the two weeks, Japan’s national flowers, cherry blossoms (sakura), are blooming and attracting many people, Japanese and foreigners. Kyoto is especially popular during this period because of its age-old sakura trees in the traditional setting of temples and shrines. Some of the famous temples and shrines are open even in the nighttime. This tour will take you to those famous spots for sakura. I can coordinate this tour according to your needs and interest. Because some of those spots are very crowded, you might not want to go. Instead there are quiet spots with fewer people or places where you can sit and drink. Tour Duration: 3 Hours Maximum Number of People: 10 Tour Type: Walking Only Tour Highlights: Some of the recommended Sakura Spots: Toji Temple, Hirano Shrine, Miidera Temple, Ishiyamadera Temple, Sakamoto area
strTitle: Go on a Kyoto Cherry Blossoms (Sakura) Night Viewing Tour

strIntroduction: This tour is basically a private tour. Anyone can join it, but since garden's road is graveled, using strollers or wheelchairs might be difficult. In the tea house inside Sankeien Garden, you can enjoy a tea ceremony and taste matcha green tea with Japanese confectionery. This program in the tea house is officially offered by Sankeien Garden, so it is up to the guest whether to participate. The extra activity will cost 500 JPY per person and it doesn't include the guiding fee. I will pick you up at Motomachi-Chukagai Station or JR Negishi Station. Alternatively, we can meet at the entrance of Sankeien Garden.
strTitle: Visit Sankeien Garden in Yokohama

strIntroduction: One of Japan's most iconic spring scenes is the fields of shibazakura flowers. Unlike traditional Japanese cherry blossoms, shibazakura come in a variety of colors including, whites, pinks and purples. These unique flowers grow together in thick bunches, creating the illusion of a glorious and colorful flower carpet. On this tour you will travel from Nagoya Station up to Mt. Chausu to see Shibazakura Hill. From there, we will travel to Hamamatsu Flower Park and Enjoy the Hamanako Flower Festa (limited time only). We will conclude our trip back at Nagoya Sation at the end of the day. Book your trip today to some of the most famous spring sightseeing spots in Japan! ※Itinerary※ - Meeting Point: Nagoya Station West Exit, ESCA Underground Shopping Mall. (7:20) - Departure from Nagoya Station by bus to Chausuyama Plateau (90 minutes) - Hamamatsui (shopping) (20 minutes) - Hamamatsu Flower Park (Hamanako Flower Festa) (90 minutes) - Return to Nagoya Station (17:50) Lunch is included in this tour.
strTitle: See Shibazakura on One Day Bus Tour to Shizuoka from Nagoya

strIntroduction: Hakone is a beautiful destination for a spring vacation! The three attractions for this tour are as follows: - The Fuji Shibazakura Festival (for a limited-time only) Around 800,000 shibazakuras bloom this time of year at the foot of Mt. Fuji, the national symbol of Japan and a World Heritage site. - Hakone Sightseeing Cruise Ship Go on a sightseeing cruise around the scenic Lake Ashi on a "Pirate Ship". - Azaleas in Himenosawa Park The best time to see the 60,000 blooming azaleas is from late April to mid-May, so book your trip today! ※Itinerary※ Day 1 - 7:40 - 9:00 Depart from Shin-Osaka Station by bullet train. (approximately one hour) - Arrive at Gifu Hashima Station - Bus from Gifu Hashima Station to Numazu, Shizuoka (stop for shopping) (30 minutes) - Bus from Numazu to Himenosawa Park (40 minutes) - Bus from Himenosawa Park to Hakonemachi Port for Pirate Ship cruising (40 minutes) - Cruise from Hakone Machi Port to Tokendai Port - Spend the night at Hakone Sengokuhara Onsen (hot spring) Dinner will be provided at Hotel Hakone Powell. Day 2 - Take a bus from Hakone Sengokuhara Onsen to Lake Yamanaka (20 minutes) - Bus to Oshino Hakkai (50 minutes) - Bus to Lake Kawaguchi and visit the surrounding area (70 minutes) - Bus to Lake Saiko (25 minutes) - Bus to Lake Shoji (20 minutes) - Bus to Lake Motosu for the Fuji Shibazakura Festival (60 minutes) - Bus to Hamamatsu Station - Bullet train from Hamamatsu Station to Shin-Osaka Station (Arrive 19:30-21:00). Breakfast will be provided at Hotel Hakone Powell.
strTitle: Enjoy a 2-Day Spring Sightseeing Tour From Osaka to Hakone!

strIntroduction: Visit some of the best cherry blossom viewing spots in Nagoya by bicycle with our knowledgeable and fun guide and find out how to enjoy the cherry blossoms the proper Japanese way. First, we will take you to Nagoya castle for sakura blossoms, we'll then pick up your bento at depachika in Sakae and head to Tsuruma Park for hanami. In Tsuruma park we will find a spot with a nice view of cherry blossoms and have a picnic while admiring the trees. Availability: Mid-April, time varies according to cherry blossom forecasts and weather conditions. Can also be held in Ferbuary for seeing plum blossoms, if the weather allows. *Can be offered year-round if you do not seek cherry blossoms. *RECOMMENDED: Nagoya Castle has a Spring festival starting on March 26th! Length of the tour: 4 hours Itinerary: 10:00 - Meet at Sakae Station and pick up bikes 10:10 - Ride to Nagoya Castle 10:20 - Nagoya Castle and Meijo Koen 11:30 - Bike to Sakae along Horikawa 11:45 - Lunch purchase at Mitsukoshi depachika 12:15 - Leave Mitsukoshi and head to Tsurumai Koen 12:45 - Lunch at Tsurumai Koen 13:30 - Leave Tsurumai Koen 13:45 - Back at the bike store *Please choose the appropriate option when booking the tour. The price is per person, so if your group is 2 or more participants, please book the tour the according number of times.
strTitle: View Cherry Blossoms by Bicycle with a Picnic in Nagoya

strIntroduction: This half-day tour will take you to many beautiful locations featuring some of the best Sakura blossom viewing sport around Nagoya. We will start the tour from visit to Depachika shopping mall for purchasing lunch or sweets for the picnic. Next, we will head right to Tsurumai park, featuring 1,200 Cherry trees, for enjoying Japanese traditional HANAMI picnic - eating while looking at blossoming cherry trees. Tsumurai park has over 100 years of history and is a fusion of European and Japanese style garden. After picnic we will spend an hour at Togokusan Fruit Park featuring about Weeping Sakura type, besides many orchards and fruit orangeries. Finally, we will visit Nagoya Castle's Spring Festival for viewing over 1,600 Sakura blossoming trees in evening illumination and enjoying many food stalls and entertainment. At the end, the coach will take you back to the starting location. You may choose to stay at the festival if you prefer. RECOMMENDED: March 26-April 10 Nagoya Castle has Spring Festival where you can enjoy Evening Illuminations, food stalls, and performances in the evening. *Outside of these dates the illumination might not be available* *If you decide to have a private tour, you might be able to adjust the itinerary. Please contact us beforehand if you would like to change the coach route* *If you are having a private tour, we will pick you up at your hotel. Otherwise please come to the meeting location* Sample itinerary: 13:30 Meet at Nagoya Station or Sakae. Purchase sweets at Mitsukoshi Depachika or Takashimaya 14:15 Leave for Tsurumai Park 14:45 snack picnic at Tsurumai Park 15:45 Leave Tsurumai Park 16:30 Arrive at Togokusan Fruit Park 17:30 Leave the fruit park 18:15 Nagoya Castle (lit up sakura) 19:30 back at Sakae or Nagoya Station
strTitle: See all the Best Cherry Blossoms in Nagoya

strIntroduction: Enjoy winter activities in Hokkaido by making a reservation for this JR Day Trip Ski Pack with your family and friends! There are three different destinations for this JR Day Trip Ski Pack, which are Tomamu, Sahoro, and Niseko. All destinations include the round trip JR train ticket (for Tomamu and Sahoro, the train tickets are designated in advance), 1 day ticket for lift & gondola, and rental ski set (skis, poles, and boots). The ski resorts for each destinations are Hoshino Resort Tomamu, Sahoro Resort, and Niseko Hirafu or Niseko Village Ski Resort. Except for Niseko Village Ski Resort, the plan includes the round trip JR train ticket, Niseko Village Ski Lift and Gondola 8 hour ticket, lunch, hot springs, and does not include the rental ski sets. The Tomamu Ski Resort has a lot of bells and whistles that make it incredibly family friendly. The resort is the most extravagant in Hokkaido, as it has 50 meters wave pool, glamorous restaurants, and peculiar looking sky-scraper hotel towers. The ski courses suite to all levels of skiers, so everyone can enjoy skiing at this resort. The resort is also friendly to kids, as it has an adventure terrain park and kids-specific park. The amenities and infrastructures of this resort is top notch. Sahoro Resort in Hokkaido is a reasonably small to medium sized with only 17 courses that suite all levels of skiers. The lifts are well developed with a gondola, 2 high speed quads, and 5 other lifts. The slopes of Sahoro are uncrowded, although sometimes the lift queues can develop at the gondola if there are a lot of local school kids. This resort offers various other activities during winter such as evening grooming tours, fishing, snow shoe tours (3 hours), snow rafting behind a snowmobile, snow field horseback trekking (30 or 50 minutes rides), and tubing and sledding. Niseko Grand Hirafu Village is a cultural mountain paradise in Hokkaido. The village is internationally recognized for amazing snowfalls, great skiing, snowboarding and a long winter season, which make Hirafu is truly a unique ski town. You can also enjoy world class dining, relaxing hot springs, bars and events at this resort too. Niseko Village Ski Resort sits within the Niseko United ski area, that accesses inter-linked ski resorts boasting a combined 2,191 acres of skiable terrain. The resort is strategically located at the base of Mount Niseko Annupuri and it offers the award-winning hotels with spa and hot spring facilities, a dining and retail village hub, luxury residences, and international snow school and alpine activities. The restaurant is open from 11:30 to 14:30, and the hot springs is open from 13:00. The lunch is either buffet or set menu. Bath and face towels are included in the plan too. The Itinerary for each destination is as follows: For Tomamu - Departing from Sapporo Station to Tomamu Station with Limited Express Super Tokachi (designated train) - Departing from Tomamu Station to Hoshino Resort Tomamu with shuttle bus - Spend time at Hoshino Resort Tomamu - Departing from Hoshino Resort Tomamu to Tomamu Station with shuttle bus - Departing from Tomamu Station to Sapporo Station with Limited Super Express Tokachi (designated train). For Sahoro - Departing from Sapporo Station to Shintoku Station with Limited Express Super Tokachi (designated train) - Departing from Shintoku Station to Sahoro Resort with shuttle bus - Spend time ant Sahoro Resort - Departing from Sahoro Resort to Shintoku Station with shuttle bus - Departing from Shintoku Station to Sapporo Station with Limited Super Express Tokachi (designated train). For Niseko Grand Hirafu - Departing from Sapporo Station to Otaru Station with local or rapid train - Departing from Otaru Station to Kutchan Station with local train - Departing from Kutchan Station to Niseko Grand Hirafu with local bus (Niseko bus) - Spend time at Niseko Grand Hirafu - Departing from Niseko Grand HIrafu to Kutchan Station with local bus (Niseko bus) - Departing from Kutchan Station to Otaru Station with local train - Departing from Otaru Station to Sapporo Station with local or rapid train - Schedule for the local bus departing to or from Kutchan Station is as follows: Kutchan Station 7:55 → Hirafu Welcome Center 8:13 Kutchan Station 9:40 → Hirafu Welcome Center 9:58 Kutchan Station 13:00 → Hirafu Welcome Center 13:18 Hirafu Welcome Center 13:30 → Kutchan Station 13:48 Hirafu Welcome Center 15:42 → Kutchan Station 16:00 Hirafu Welcome Center 16:07 → Kutchan Station 16:25 Hirafu Welcome Center 17:30 → Kutchan Station 17:48 Hirafu Welcome Center 18:48 → Kutchan Station 19:06 For Niseko Village Ski Resort - Departing from Sapporo Station to Otaru Station with local or rapid train - Departing from Otaru Station to Kutchan Station with local train - Departing from Kutchan Station to Niseko Village Ski Resort with shuttle bus - Spend time at Niseko Village Ski Resort - Departing from Niseko Village Ski Resort to Kutchan Station with shuttle bus - Departing from Kutchan Station to Otaru Station with local train - Departing from Otaru Station to Sapporo Station with local or rapid train

strIntroduction: This is a ten hour private sightseeing tour in a spacious van with a driver and a translator ready to take you anywhere you like! This tour is ideal for small groups of up to five people, and it's great for one day visits to Mt. Fuji and lake Kawaguchi-ko area, but you can decide where you want to go. Whether it's an exhaustive city tour of Tokyo, or the natural beauties of Kanagawa and Yamanashi prefectures, you'll have plenty of time to explore the sights in a relaxed and convenient way! The tour includes the driver so you don't have to worry about figuring out the routes, and a translator to facilitate communication with the driver so meeting places and times are clear and your trip goes smoothly. Here's an idea of how you can use this tour to make the most out of your trip: 9:00 Pick-up at your hotel in Tokyo or Chiba prefecture 12:00 Visit of Mt. Fuji 5th station 14:00 Stop for Lunch 15:00 Visit Lake Kawaguchi 16:00 Shopping Gotemba Premium Outlet for shopping 19:00 Arrival at your hotel.
strTitle: Explore Mt.Fuji area with a private car sightseeing tour

strIntroduction: Yanaka is one of the few districts in Tokyo where the shitamachi atmosphere, an old town ambience reminiscent of Tokyo from past decades, still survives. Throughout the district, there is an air of nostalgia and a rustic charm. In this tour, we will take you to several beautiful hitstorical spot, have some great pictures. Through the site seeing, you will find many cats around the town.After siteseeing tour, you will try some traditional Japanese foods!!
strTitle: Traditional Japanese Food & Art Tour in Old Town Yanaka

strIntroduction: First of all, we meet up at your hotel or a station you like. Then we go to the area of Fukagawa and stroll around temples, shrines, gardens, etc. Local festivals takes place every month. Perhaps you can see one. The tour cost is per person for 4 hours and includes lunch or dinner. Let's enjoy walking together! Fukagawa is located in the east side of Sumida River in Tokyo's Koto ward. The culture of Edo period is still alive in this area. This is also the place where Basho, the famous haiku poet and author of the classic "Oku no hosomichi" lived in his later years. 500 years ago, when Ieyasu Tokugawa, the founder of the Edo shogunate first came to this area, Fukagawa was a marsh. But it was filled in to provide new land for the city and farming. Hachiro Uzaemon Fukagawa, a native of Osaka city, developed the area and named the village after himself. These were the roots of Fukagawa. Now it is a peaceful downtown with a taste of old Tokyo. An alley takes you back in time to the old era. The local shop selling short neck clams boiled in soy sauce offers a savory treat that has been popular for a hundred of years.
strTitle: Take a walk around Fukagawa area in Tokyo with locals

strIntroduction: Stroll through a historical arts and culture area of Tokyo that is popular among both young and old local people. Ningyocho is sophisticated district of old downtown Edo with rich history and tradition.
strTitle: Taste Local Japanese Food & Experience Culture in Ningyocho

strIntroduction: Daikanyama is a source of the latest fashion and is also a high-class residential location. When you walking through the street, you can see many fashionable people ,unique shop and modern architecture. In this tour, we will take you to see several modern architecture, histerical architecture. After that, will take a break to have great tea and sweets.
strTitle: Modern Day Hipster：Daikanyama Art & Design Walk

strIntroduction: If you will stay in Osaka during the cherry blossom season, you should definitely check out this unique cruise program to enjoy the astonishing view of cherry blossom trees in Osaka. You will cruise along the Okawa river, a famous cherry blossoms viewing spot. Enjoy the breathtaking and hypnotizing cherry blossoms views, while spending precious time with you friends or family. You will also see Osaka's famous historical places and tourist spots such as OMM building, Osaka Castle, Sakuranomiya Bridge, Japan Mint, Kawasaki Bridge, and Temmabashi Bridge, as the cruise will pass by these spots. The program is available from March 26th to April 10th, 2016. Free admission for one child(under 12 years old) per one adult. Schedule: The cruise will depart every 10 to 30 minutes in between 10:00 to 19:00 ( in between 14:00 to 19:00 on March 26, 2016). The length of the tour is around 25 minutes. The cruise will depart from Hachikenya Port. The location of Hachikenya Port is right by Keihan's Line Temmabashi Station Gate 17. Please note that: - The schedule might be changed or canceled due to bad weather. - The program will be operated by different boat depending on the day. - The program will be operated by roofed boat when it rains, but the program will be canceled due to heavy weather.
strTitle: Cruise Along Okawa River with Cherry Blossoms View in Osaka!

strIntroduction: How about a luxurious and relaxing cruise in Odaiba, Tokyo? On this tour, you will be able to enjoy a 60-minute cruise on a limousine boat. The limousine boat is designed to cruise stably and quietly. From its silver metallic body, its gull-wing doors open out to welcome customers. Inside there is a luxurious and relaxing sofa. On this tour you can enjoy the sea breeze from the windows and sitting inside the room. The route of the cruise is especially chosen to enable viewing the modern icons of Tokyo such as the Tokyo SkyTree and the Rainbow Bridge. After the luxurious cruising, you will have lunch at the elegant restaurant Hilton Tokyo Odaiba. Itenerary: -Meet Up, Nihombashi Station (Tokyo metro / Ginza -Line) (9:50) -Walk, Port for the Limousine Boat. -Cruise, Limousine Boat Cruising (approx.1 hour) Sights on the cruise: -Kiyosubashi Bridge - View Tokyo SkyTree from the boat. -Odaiba Marine Park -Rainbow Bridge -Haneda Airport Runway B (See air planes flying over your head.) -Palette Town (Leave the ship) -Walk - Hilton Tokyo Odaiba (Have lunch. Disband 13:00 after lunch.)
strTitle: Enjoy cruising on a Limousine Boat in Odaiba, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Reserve your airport transfer from/to Kansai International airport to Osaka city center with a limousine bus! Usually, the bus company only sells tickets on the departure day, but with this reservation, you'll secure your airport transfer before you even land in Osaka, so that when you get there, you won't have to worry about finding transportation into the city. The bus departs from terminals 1 and 2 at Kansai International airport and stops at major hotels in Osaka city center. Stops: -Kansai airport Terminal 2 -Kansai airport Terminal 1 -Shin-Hankyu hotel -Herbis Osaka -Hilton Osaka -Hotel Hankyu International -Westin Hotel Osaka -Senri New Town -Senri Chuo Whether you are planning to stay at any of these hotels or nearby, this is an excellent choice to get into Osaka city center with a fast and convenient service! For your way back to the airport, you can also ride the limousine bus at any of these hotels, for a fast and easy transfer to Kansai International airport.
strTitle: Get tickets for Limousine Bus from/to Kansai Airport, Osaka

strIntroduction: I will organize a unique trip for you in Osaka! We will meet in Namba Osaka at 10:00 am. Then, we will go to the beauty salon first. You can choose between receiving a gel nail polish or a high-quality eyelash extension (please choose one). After we're done, we'll go have lunch somewhere (let me know if you have food preferences; lunch is not included in the price of this tour). Next, I can take you to a place of your choice. Send me your requests, for example: I want to find nice second-hand shop! I want to buy color lens from Japan! I want to go to a Maid Cafe for lunch! I want to do something special! I want to eat Osaka's best takoyaki! I'll try to follow the requests from your list. Finally, we will go to an animal cafe (cat or owl - please choose one) and have some cake and nice tea. Enjoy a girl's tour around Osaka!
strTitle: Embark on an Osaka Beauty and Fun Tour for Girls!

strIntroduction: This is a Japanese home-style cooking class for foreigners. This class has had more than 200 foreigners in the past two years. Now it’s hot among Japanese media, some newspapers, magazines and NHK TV. Now luxurious classes with fewer than 15 attendees in a group are available! Profile of the Chef: Tominaga is an organizer of famous and popular cooking lessons in Japan for foreigners. More than 200 foreigners in Japan have attended her classes in past. Many love her recipes because of the Japanese taste and the seasonal materials she arranges, as well as the easiness to make the dishes at home. All dishes she made are amazing. Once her friends have tasted her dishes, certainly they come back to her cooking lesson. New recipes are introduced at each lesson. Tominaga's records in media 2016.2 “Dream Dinner Table” TV Show by BS Fuji 2016.1 Supervising English Edition of ”Simple & Testy Japanese Dinner” 2015.12 “Cooking class for Foreigner Japanese Traditional New Year Celebration Food called “Osechi” TV Show by News Every on Nippon TV 2015.10 DVD teaching material for junior high school student by Benesse Corporation 2015.9 “global spreading of Japanese Food” TV Show News Every by Nippon TV 2015.9 Article on Nikkei Newspaper 2015.3 Article on Nikkei Newspaper 2014,12 “Cooking Class for foreigner” TCV Show Good Morning Japan by NHK 2014,12 “Evolving Cooking Class” TV Show Morning Bird by TV Asahi 2014,12 “Developing Communication network” article by food by Kanagawa Newspaper 2014,10 “Spreading Japanese Culture by Japanese food TV” TV Show Kanagawa News alpha 930 2014.9 Article on magazine Nikkei Off time for adult Details of the lesson: In this lesson you can experience making a traditional Japanese home style recipe. We offer you a new arrangement of the Japanese recipe every time. This is because it’s important to feel the sense of seasons and the taste of seasonable ingredients at every moment. You can enjoy those tastes through seasonable vegetables and some other ingredients. Tominaga's recipes includes a main dish, a side dish, a Japanese soup and a dessert. The recipes for those 4 dishes are not complicated, they are considered for the learner. But you can grasp the basic matter of the traditional Japanese cooking from the lesson even though it is simpliﬁed for beginners. And the results should be almost the same level as expert's cooking. For example, you will learn in the lesson how to make dashi soup stock, that is a basic item for the Japanese cooking. It’s a kind of broth (bonito stock / kombu kelp stock) that makes the base ﬂavor of various dishes. You will receive the recipes printed after the class. Time schedule of the lesson: 11:00-11:15 Introduction and preparation 11:15-12:45 Demonstration and lessons 12:45-13:30 Tasting time! Place The studio is at Akebonobashi which is two minutes walk from Shinjuku Station. It’s in the center of Tokyo and easy to access. The cooking studio is spacious and properly bright.
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese Home Style Cooking Class

strIntroduction: The custom of Hanami (Sakura blossom viewing) is celebrated every year in Japan during spring. While often it's a picnic or a walk in a park, this tour give you the unique experiences of viewing Sakura also from the air and the water. Nestled by the Hira Mountain range in the Shiga prefecture lies the largest freshwater lake in Japan, Lake Biwa. The valley of Lake Biwa is known for its stunning views of Sakura blossoms. This is a one-day bus tour from Kyoto to Lake Biwa in Shiga to see Sakura. Below is the schedule of the tour: 1. Pick up - 8:00 am Hachijou-guchi, Kyoto - 8:15 am Shijou-omiya, Kyoto 2. Bus to Lake Biwa valley + Ropeway trip Sit back in a ropeway ride an enjoy enjoy a fantastic aerial view of Lake Biwa and Sakura. + Kaizu-Osaki Rated one of the Top 100 places in Japan to view Sakura by the Japan Sakura Association, on this tour you get to escape the crowds and enjoy an exclusive view of the 4 km Sakura-lined lake shore of Kaizu-Osaki from the comfort of a boat cruise. + Tsudurao hotel Enjoy a lunch of Japanese seasonal foods, then soak up the day's experiences in an open air bath, complete with a view of Sakura. + Okubiwako parkway Finally, wrap up the day with coach ride through a tunnel lined with 4000 Sakura trees stretching for 23 km. 3. Return 18:30-20:00 pm - arrive back to your pick up place.
strTitle: Enjoy Sakura from the water and the air near Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This is an extravagant one day tour where you'll be able to visit 3 different cherry blossom (sakura) locations in Nara, Japan's ancient capital. Each place is famous for old and beautiful Sakura trees and you will be amazed with the 2 wonderful trees that have kept blooming for over 100 and 300 years! Kyoto is a very famous place during the cherry blossom season, but Nara also has very beautiful places too. This tour is ideal for people who would like to enjoy the whole day viewing different Sakura sites. *Optional: You can order a Japanese lunch box which will be served on the bus. The lunch box includes fish, meat, vegetables and rice and comes with tea. A reservation is required 7 days prior to the departure. Payment is also required when you pay for the tour price. Available dates: Mar 30 - Apr 11 (Exclude Apr 4 & 8 ） Schedule : Picking up from the places below. -Umeda (8:15) -Namba (8:05) Sights on the tour: -Matabei Sakura (View cherry blossoms [approx. 60min]) -Miwa Somen speciality shop (Enjoy shopping [approx. 20min]) -Himuro-jinja Shrine (View cherry blossoms [approx. 60min]) -Nara Nagomi-kan (Enjoy shopping [25min]) A row of cherry trees(Sahogawa )/Seen from bus window -Koriyama Castle Ruins (View cherry blossoms [approx. 60min]) Arriving back to Umeda or Namba (17:00-18:00) -Matabee Sakura: View a 300-year-old cherry tree (the weeping cherry variety) *The best time to view its cherry blossoms is from early to mid April. -Himuro-jinja Shrine: View 100-year-old cherry trees (the Edohigan Sakura variety) *The best time to view cherry blossoms is from late March to mid April. -Koriyama Castle Ruins : View 1,000 trees of cherry blossoms (the weeping cherry variety).
strTitle: Enjoy a Full Day Tour of Cherry Blossom Trees in Nara

strIntroduction: Have you seen a theater play in Japan? Do you want to experience Japanese culture in an innovative way? If you want to do both, this is the activity to join! Our 3-hour tour starts with an entertaining and inspiring theater play at a mini theater located in Kobe. The theme of the play this time is “ODEN”, one of the most loved Japanese winter dishes. Not only will you have fun time watching the show, but you can also learn much about “ODEN”: What is it? Why we like it? How to eat it? During the play, nice Japanese green tea will be served. After you enjoyed the play, we will move to a local Izakaya (traditional drinking restaurant) in the neighborhood (5 minutes by walk). And of course, you get to try real oden there. We provide a set of oden and a choice of drink. If you have anything you cannot eat, please inform us in advance. The theater play will be conducted in English. Our tour coordinators are fluent in English and welcome any of your questions during the tour. The theater actors are very friendly and they would be happy to communicate with you, too! We all look forward to seeing you and having good time together! Time slots -From 10:30 am to 1:30 pm
strTitle: Enjoy "ODEN" at a theater and a traditional Izakaya, Kobe

strIntroduction: This meditation tour is done at the temple in pictures A, B, C and D. Pictures E and F above were taken at a Shodaigyo meditation session. You will visit an old local temple of the Nichiren Buddhist sect in a quiet district of Kanazawa. Unlike at other popular touristic spots, you will be able to enter inside and explore even the rear areas of this temple guided by a local priest. This is a unique chance to see from a close distance the relics of a Buddhist temple. The outline of the Shodaigyo Meditation Experience is as follows: 1. Learn about Shodaigyo meditation. 2. (About 5 minutes) Do Zazen, a silent meditation. (If you can’t sit cross-legged (seiza) for about 40 minutes, you can also sit in a chair) 3. (About 30 minutes) When you hear the taiko drum and mokusho—a wooden block that makes a sound, and are used like a metronome when we chant sutras—start to chant the Buddhist sutra repeating after the priest. We will start with a slow rhythm, which will get faster gradually. When everyone matches the rhythm and chants loudly, we will chant faster. We will chant with a fast rhythm for a long time. This is the main part of the meditation and people will hear the chanting everywhere in the temple. This is the best time to concentrate on the meditation. After this part, everyone’s rhythm will slow down again. When the chanting ends, the taiko drum and the mokusho will stop, and the temple will become quiet again. 4. (About 5 minutes) Do Zazen silent meditation. 5. This is the end of the meditation practice. 6. Relax and enjoy green tea and Japanese sweets in the quiet temple. 7. End of the activity. The area near the temple has many old buildings and roads and is within a walking distance of Higashi Chaya geisha district. You can enjoy walking around the backstreets to feel the spirit of the local neighborhood.
strTitle: Experience Shodaigyo Meditation near Higashi Chaya, Kanazawa

strIntroduction: This plan is only held on Mar 29, 30, Apr 1, 3, but it's the season for seeing sakura. The tour bus will pick you up from Kyoto and take you to Hyogo Prefecture and return you at the end of the day. Your guide will tell you all about the historical facts regarding each site and take you to some of the best spots to see the sakura views! The restaurant also gives you a quirky taste of Japanese style, since this building is an old wooden house as you can see from the photos. Schedule: Meeting at Kyoto Hachijou-guchi (7:45) or Kyoto Shijou Omiya (8:00) A bus tour to Sasayama Castle, Kasuga Shrine, Himeji Castle and lunch at a french restaurant Nipponia. Arriving back at the place you were picked up. (18:00-19:00) *When the participants do not reach 28 people , the tour will not be operated. - Sasayama Castle A historic place located in Hyogo prefecture, the castle was build in 1608. Now we only see remains such as stone walls and the rebuilt Oosyoin building. This place is famous for 1000 Sakura trees which were planted all around the castle. - Kasuga Shrine Located close to Sasayama Castle and famous for Nougaku stage, a classical Japanese musical drama stage. - French restaurant Nipponia Also located close to Sasayama castle and famous for its quirky atmosphere, this restaurant is a part of a hotel which used to be old Japanese houses. - Himeji castle Built in 1346 it is a World Cultural Heritage site and a National treasure. This castle is also surrounded by 1000 Sakura trees and chosen as one of "100 of the most famous places for seeing Sakura."
strTitle: View Cherry Blossoms in Hyogo on a Bus Tour from Kyoto

strIntroduction: Opened in 1977, Kawachi Wisteria (Fuji) Garden has 22 kinds of wisteria flowers together with exciting ways to display them, such as wisteria trellises, the wisteria dome, the wisteria tunnel, and a large wisteria tree. There is also a belvedere from which you are able to look down on the wisteria trellises. In recent years the garden received international attention by being featured as one of the most beautiful spots in Japan by foreign media. This garden is open every day from mid-April to mid-May, but the highlight of the wisteria blossoming is expected between April 22 and May 7. During this period entry is only allowed by obtaining a pre-paid ticket in advance, and then paying additional 500 JPY or 1000 JPY at the door depending on the daily changing price (due to flower blooming condition). IMPORTANT: Note that the entrance fee to be paid on the door changes from 500 JPY to 1000 JPY based on the day during the wisteria blooming season. The price of this activity includes only the compulsory pre-paid ticket for the Kawachi Wisteria Garden. Please pay the difference with the actual price on the day in cash when you arrive at the park. Note that you CANNOT enter during the high season without a pre-paid ticket bought in advance. Access: From Fukuoka city, take the bullet train to Kokura Station and change to a local train for Yawata Station. From Yawata Station you can take a shuttle bus to the Kawachi Wisteria Garden (operates once per hour only during the high season) or taxi for about 20-30 minutes. There is also a free shuttle bus going to the nearby hot spring facility "Ajisai no Yu" located next to the garden, but you can only ride it if you enter the hot spring or have lunch at the facility (not as free transportation only).
strTitle: Get Tickets to Kawachi Fuji Garden, Wisterias in Fukuoka!

strIntroduction: In this tour you will explore Arashiyama, enjoy Sagano romantic train, visit Nanzen-ji temple and stroll Philosopher’s walk street in Kyoto. The tour also includes Temari-sushi lunch box! In Arashiyama you can enjoy the Yakata-bune of Arashiyama to see the beautiful cherry blossoms in Oigawa River. Yakata-bune is a traditional Japanese type of boat. Arashiyama is selected as top 100 popular spots to see cherry blossoms and therefore it is worth to go there! Since it is a small boat, not many locals have experienced this too! From Sagano Romantic Train you can enjoy the beautiful, elegant cherry blossom trees for about 7.3km long. One way takes about 25 minutes. The brilliant view from the train makes you feel like you’re in another world. Once you see this scenery of the mixture of river and the cherry blossoms it makes you want to come back again. The train also runs under the cherry blossom tunnel! At Nanzen-ji temple you can enjoy about 200 of cherry blossom trees. Therefore you can experience the luxury atmosphere by watching cherry blossoms in a Japanese traditional temple. Philosopher’s walk street is known as one of the best stroll spots for seeing cherry blossoms in Kyoto. There are 450 cherry trees along the street so the walk is a popular destination for tourists and locals especially during Hanami season. This tour is only available on April 3rd, 5th and 7th. Itinerary: (Main transportation will be by bus) 08.45am Meet your guide at Kyoto station Visit Arashiyama – take a cruise and stroll to see cherry blossoms Take the Sagano Romantic train Visit Nanzen-ji temple Stroll the Philosopher’s Walk street 16:00 – 17:30 This tour ends in the afternoon.
strTitle: Enjoy Sagano romantic train and cherry blossoms in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: During Cherry blossom season in Japan, the Asukayama park is the one of the busiest spots for cherry blossom viewers. The 8th Shogun Yoshimune Tokugawa planted 1270 cherry blossom trees here, to give his people the pleasures of viewing the cherry blossoms. The shogun also gave his approval to the people for them to eat, drink and enjoy themselves under the cherry trees. The park is also known as the one of the oldest parks in Japan. It is a well worth visiting and reminiscing of the past. This tour takes you to the parks which are famous for weeping cherry trees too. Weeping cherry trees have long and soft branches which cascade down gracefully. You will see these beautiful weeping cherry trees in the Koishikawa Korakuen and Rikugien which are the two best Japanese landscape gardens in Tokyo. You will be able to see with your own eyes the beauty of real Japanese gardens with graceful weeping cherry trees. Worried about lunch, not a problem! Take a break after walking around the park and recharge your energy for the next part of your trip, while enjoying a special buffet lunch in a lovely hotel restaurant. You can choose from a variety of cuisines and dishes which include Italian, Chinese, Japanese and an array of deserts. The tour is scheduled to give you enough time so you don’t have to hurry. The tour starts at Shinjuku station, East gate at 9:10 or Tokyo station, Marunouchi South gate at 9: 50. The first place you visit is Koishikawa Korakuen and you will have 50 minutes to look around. After that, enjoy a lunch buffet for 60 minutes. After lunch you will go to Asukayama Park and you will have 30 minutes to look around. Then walk to the Shibusawa Memorial Museum located in the park where you will also be given 30 minutes to look around. Then on to Rikugien where you will be given 60 minutes to look around and back to Maruyama Minamiguchi. This tour ends around 16:40 1)2)https://www.hatobus.co.jp/app/search/result_list/index?pcDisplayFlag 3) http://www.tokyodome-hotels.co.jp/restaurants/rilassa/ 4)http://www.tachikawaonline.jp/local/sakura/tyo_7_kita_asuka.htm 5) http://www.kensetsu.metro.tokyo.jp/kouen/kouenannai/park/koishikawa_ko.html 6)http://www.shibusawa.or.jp/museum/facility/
strTitle: Enjoy cherry blossoms in Tokyo parks with buffet lunch
